Sustainability Specialist
Description

About Us
Mercedes-Benz is USA is responsible for the sales, marketing and service of all Mercedes-Benz and Maybach products in the United States. In our people, you will find tremendous commitment to our corporate values: 'PRIDE = Passion, Respect, Integrity, Discipline, and Execution'. Our products and employees reflect this dedication. We are looking for diverse top-notch individuals to join the Mercedes-Benz Team and uphold these hallmarks.

Job Overview
The Sustainability Specialist will be involved in diverse and high profile projects. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting MBUSA to advance towards Daimler’s goal to be carbon neutral by 2039 through the implementation of value added solutions, including sustainability reporting, stakeholder engagement, assessments, and strategy. This role will involve working closely with a wide range of both internal stakeholders and contract teams, and requires the ability to work at both a technical and big-picture strategic level. The ideal candidate will have high work ethics, a can-do attitude, enjoys fast pace environments and will place sustainability at the heart of our business.

Responsibilities
The Sustainability Specialist will be responsible for creating new and developing existing strategies for sustainability, and project management of new and existing projects. They will be part of, or lead a team that implements sustainability advisory & training projects and will support internal stakeholders in delivery of Sustainability KPIs and data capture. This will include creation and development of project delivery plans, capital investment SROIs, as well as stakeholder matrices and dashboards.
To include, but limited to;
Provide exceptional support with internal stakeholders and management that builds trust, confidence in our expertise, and reputation
Manage and deliver advisory projects including sustainability assessment and strategy, reporting, SROI, stakeholder engagement, programs (i.e. green building, etc.), assurance, training
Identify, recommend and lead improvement initiatives for internal MBUSA campuses based on gaps, opportunities, Daimler requirements, global trends, and sector benchmarking
Identify and pursue opportunities for further sustainability development, contribute in CAM service development and advancement of existing tools and solutions

Advisory Services
Create /Develop and implement Sustainability business strategy plans for MBUSA as well as individual campuses
Design strategies and deliver projects/programs to increase internal stakeholder engagement, awareness and commitment to sustainability
Project manage and deliver annual sustainability reporting projects for MBUSA in compliance with Daimler and international standards, guidelines and frameworks
Oversee sustainability report/dashboard development, ensuring alignment with MBUSA and Daimler guidelines, trends, stakeholder input & concerns and corporate strategy
Support MBUSA to identify and articulate case studies, collect accurate data and ensure quality and timeliness of stakeholder input
Write accurate and compelling content for sustainability reporting projects

Communications
Serve as the central point of contact for Sustainability at MBUSA
Prepare briefing material, presentations and reports for stakeholders and management
Identify and support opportunities to communicate sustainability case studies externally via MBUSA communication and marketing areas
Write and present business content in engaging format

Field Research
Stay up-to-date of emerging trends and best practices
Track and analyze trends in Sustainability
Perform benchmarking/auditing activities for campuses and overall business

Qualifications

Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of demonstrated experience in a sustainability related role
Excellent understanding of Sustainability / Carbon Neutral strategic approaches and advisory tools
Practical experience in Sustainability reporting
Knowledge of current national/NAFTA/international sustainability tools and trends, and their application in business
Understanding of key sustainability issues and how they can be integrated into business to create measurable value
Knowledge of sustainability requirements of local legislation, standards and international best practice
Internal stakeholder and management facing experience
Strong communication skills (verbal, written and interpersonal): Ability to communicate complex sustainability topics in simple terms, with emphasis on impact. Ability to develop written business content
Ability to think strategically, understand the big picture and adjust available solution to diverse levels
Creativity and resourcefulness: Ability to develop and execute project plans and engagement campaigns in innovative ways, problem solver
Good analytical skills – Critically analyze data to improve quality of deliverables and proposed solutions to clients. Accuracy and attention to detail required
Excellent written and verbal skills

EEO Statement
Mercedes-Benz USA is committed to fostering an inclusive environment that appreciates and leverages the diversity of our team. We provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, age, national origin, religion, marital status, veteran status, physical or other disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.


Organization Mercedes-Benz USA, LLC

Primary Location United States of America-Georgia-Atlanta

Work Locations One Mercedes-Benz Drive One Mercedes-Benz Drive Atlanta 30328
Degreed architect or engineer with 2+ years experience with USGBC LEED or similar certification programs.

Bulletin Information
This position is with the Office of Environmental and Energy Programs (OEEP), the department that leads Agency sustainability policy, target-setting, reporting, and project/program development and implementation. The Port Authority was the first US transportation agency to align with the Paris Climate Agreement, and this position will play an instrumental role in helping the Agency achieve its climate action ambitions. The Environmental Sustainability Manager (ESM) will support OEEP in setting and overseeing agency-wide environmental strategy, reporting and communication on sustainability, and implementing related sustainability programs. In particular, the ESM will be focused on efforts to embed environmental sustainability into the culture, systems and processes of the Agency, including initiatives around sustainability materiality and program design, and helping design and oversee actions focused on greenhouse gas emission mitigation, including managing the Agency’s greenhouse gas inventory.
Another focus will be managing internal and external environmental sustainability communications including sustainability/climate disclosure. Other strategic programs could include finalization and implementation of the Agency Climate Action Plan, frameworks to institutionalize climate action in business operations and capital allocation, advancing development of an Agency Environmental Social and Governance (ESG) platform, green procurement, green leasing, and tracking of non-physical climate risks.
Reporting to the Deputy Director of OEEP, the ESM will have access to senior leadership and collaboration with the Director of the department, and will be collaborating extensively with other program managers within OEEP and across the Agency. The ESM will also be the key point of contact for consultants managing the Greenhouse Gas inventory and the Climate Action Planning process. The ESM will have the capability of communicating to the public and all levels of the Agency from staff to executive leadership.
Responsibilities
Agency-wide sustainability strategy
Advance and finalize the Agency’s Climate Action Plan, with support from consultants
Oversee the implementation of the Climate Action Plan
Coordinate with colleagues at OEEP and counterparts in line departments to assist with a wide range of clean energy and other sustainability initiatives (e.g., resource conservation and greening of supply chain)
Lead initiatives to embed sustainability and aspects of broader ESG issues into the culture, policies, systems and processes of the organization
Develop a strong understanding of management system design, implementation and integration with other departments and their systems
Support monitoring and evaluation initiatives for material sustainability topics
Oversee staff and consultants managing the annual greenhouse gas inventory and climate action quantification on behalf of the agency, in collaboration with our Engineering team
Climate change communication and disclosure
Lead sustainability communications on behalf of OEEP focusing in areas such as public disclosures (voluntary and mandatory), marketing, and event
Understand sustainability related risks, risk reporting, risk controls and program design around risk reduction
Keep abreast of sustainability market trends such as the impact of ESG and climate change on capital markets, sustainability linked bonds
Articulate clearly the impacts, opportunities and risks associated with climate actions and risks to senior leadership.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure the Port Authority is taking advantage of opportunities and protecting the agency from any future risks.
Develop internal staff training initiatives and leadership briefings
Lead initiatives around internal carbon pricing and carbon fees
This position provides an excellent opportunity for an ambitious, flexible, and creative candidate to interface with various Port Authority departments and external stakeholders to advance the Agency’s sustainability and greenhouse gas reduction goals.
Qualifications
Candidates must present the following qualifications to be considered eligible for this position:
Bachelor’s degree in environmental science, business, engineering, policy or management from an accredited college or university with aptitude in strategy, policy, communications, data analytics and reporting
Master’s or other graduate degree in similar fields preferred
Minimum of 7 years of professional experience in sustainability/ESG consulting, sustainability management for private sector organizations or non-profit focused on ESG/climate action
Experience in any or all of the areas of aviation, maritime ports, public and private transportation, and transportation infrastructure
Experience with various clean energy solutions such as renewables, energy efficiency, electric vehicles, clean fuels.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to make concise presentations to a variety of audiences
Demonstrated people management skills
Experience in climate action and sustainability planning processes
Desired
Other strategic programs (experience in any of the below topics will be viewed favorably)
In addition to the above core functions, the ESM would investigate the potential of the following programs and develop and implement the most promising ones:
Green procurement
Green leasing policies
Green bonds (in close collaboration with Agency Finance groups)
Valuing carbon emissions
Green economy and green jobs
Embodied carbon and circularity in construction
Environmental justice
Air quality and other community impacts
Compensation & Benefits
The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey offers a competitive salary, an outstanding benefits package and a professional environment that supports development and recognizes achievement.
How To Apply
Interested candidates should apply to this job by clicking on the Apply Now button and submitting a combined cover letter and resume. The Port Authority of NY & NJ welcomes veteran and military spouse applications.

Only applicants under consideration will be contacted.
About The Port Authority
Founded in 1921, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey builds, operates, and maintains many of the most important transportation and trade infrastructure assets in the country. The agency's network of aviation, ground, rail, and seaport facilities is among the busiest in the country, supports more than 550,000 regional jobs, and generates more than $23 billion in annual wages and $80 billion in annual economic activity. The Port Authority also owns and manages the 16-acre World Trade Center site, where the 1,776-foot-tall One World Trade Center is now the tallest skyscraper in the Western Hemisphere.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey/Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

INCOG, the Metropolitan Planning Organization for the Tulsa area, is seeking qualified candidates for the
position of Sustainability Project Specialist. The selected candidate will work with a variety of INCOG’s

activities within these programs.

relations and public policy and have (or demonstrate ability to quickly learn) a functional understanding of
technical issues related to ambient air quality, clean transportation technologies, energy efficiency, electric
vehicles, and/or smart cities and emerging mobility technologies.
Candidates should have strong research and writing skills to assist with various ongoing local, state and federal
Air Quality and Clean Cities reporting requirements, and additionally assist with the development of grant
proposals. Experience with federal and state grant funding, proposal writing, and program management is
preferred but not required.
This position will assume the communications, marketing and outreach responsibilities for INCOG’s Air Quality,
Ozone Alert, Commercial Property Assessed Clean Energy Financing, and Tulsa Area Clean Cities programs,
including the management of websites and social media accounts. Candidates will demonstrate ability to develop
and implement media campaigns, develop marketing outreach materials, coordinate stakeholder meetings, public
media events and effectively communicate with diverse groups of public and private professionals.
Candidates shall also have experience with or be able to accomplish and/or assist with the following:
Developing and implementing strategic plans and programs;
Research, evaluation and analysis of regulatory and technical data, and the ability to effectively translate
and communicate those results in various formats to diverse audiences;
Grant and financial management
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Suites;
Website development and management;
Planning, development and implementation of public outreach media materials and campaigns;
Planning and hosting workshops, meetings, conferences and public outreach events;
Facilitating program stakeholder growth and engagement;
Grant writing;
Public speaking;
Managing multiple social media accounts.
Candidates should possess a bachelor’s degree or higher in environmental policy, urban and regional planning,
or public administration, or a related field and relevant work experience of at least 3 years, or advanced degree in
lieu of work experience.
Working environment is primarily indoors in an office setting. Will require time working with program
stakeholders outside of the office both during and outside of normal work hours.

Tulsa, Oklahoma, 74103-3123 or email to: incog@incog.org.

The Studio School is currently hiring qualified candidates to instruct Sustainability + Environment courses within our General Education department. Instructor will teach Sustainability + Environment to filmmakers and performing artists, using examples from popular media to demonstrate the role of physics in contemporary culture, equip next generation artists with an understanding of the field’s past, present and future, and support creative projects through which students translate concepts from class into narrative art.


All Faculty report to the Department Chair. Faculty works closely with the school's administrators, academic advisers and administrative staff. Successful candidates are high-energy leaders with a passion for teaching and a collaborative style that promotes integrity, empowers vision, displays flexibility and inspires creativity.

Job Description Summary
The Vice President, Sustainability and Environment, Health and Safety (EHS&S) is responsible for leading and driving all aspects of BD’s Sustainability programs and initiatives and BD’s global EHS&S function. They have accountability, along with the BD Executive Leadership Team, for performance against BD’s publicly stated sustainability goals.
Job Description
GENERAL FUNCTION:
The Vice President, Sustainability and Environment, Health and Safety (EHS&S) is responsible for leading and driving all aspects of BD’s Sustainability programs and initiatives and BD’s global EHS&S function. They have accountability, along with the BD Executive Leadership Team, for performance against BD’s publicly stated sustainability goals. The role’s portfolio includes associate safety, environmental affairs, product stewardship governance and compliance, EHS governance and compliance, human rights programs, sustainability metrics and analytics, energy/water/waste management, and ESG reporting and disclosures. This leader will partner and co-lead sustainability strategies embedded within key functions and business platforms. They will engage externally through multiple stakeholder channels to identify other emerging areas of responsible business and continuously prepare BD to meet and exceed stakeholder expectations. They will represent BD in external sustainability and EHS coalitions, industry associations and events.
A member of the Integrated Supply Chain Leadership Team and BD Leadership team, this position reports to the Executive Vice President, Integrated Supply Chain and will be based at BD’s worldwide headquarter offices in Franklin Lakes, NJ. This leader will partner with leaders across BD’s business teams, regional teams and central teams to drive multiple initiatives aligned to BD’s 2030 sustainability program, including the integration of sustainability into product portfolios, customer-facing strategies and transforming operations infrastructure and supply chains to increase resilience and meet sustainability goals.
This leader will manage the central EHS&S staff, comprised of sustainability, EHS and product stewardship professionals in a variety of specialties, including environmental management, EHS auditing, process safety, product stewards and sustainability subject matter experts. They will also be responsible for developing and cultivating EHS&S talent across the organization, comprised of over 300 professionals working at the site, region and business unit level.
ACCOUNTABILITY:
Overall execution of the Sustainability program and performance to 2030+ sustainability goals.
EHS governance and compliance, globally, including certified management systems, audit program, regulatory sensing, standards setting and injury/illness prevention.
Product Stewardship governance and compliance, globally, including oversight of individual business units meeting unique compliance requirements for their portfolios, under REACH, RoHS, Prop.65, etc.
Human Rights management and ensuring close coordination on compliance requirements with key functions including legal, HR, ethics/compliance and procurement.
Sensing new and emerging stakeholder requirements and actioning work, as appropriate, across the organization.
Talent management and development of EHS&S staff, globally.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide oversight and of EHS and product stewardship compliance programs and be involved in critical decision making and escalation of issues to leadership, as appropriate.
Lead the next evolution of Sustainability and ESG at BD through enterprise-wide engagement in developing, executing and delivering on leading sustainability programs and initiatives.
Shape and deliver the sustainability and ESG narrative for BD and cultivate stakeholder relationships through ongoing engagement work.
Partner with key internal stakeholders, such as Public Affairs, Communications, Investor Relations, HR/ID&E and Legal to ensure sustainability and ESG disclosures and communications are reaching key stakeholders.
Build and maintain relationships with critical stakeholder groups including industry coalitions, environmental groups, and sustainability professionals for key customers and suppliers.
Structure & Reporting Arrangements:
This position will report directly to the EVP, Integrated Supply Chain.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
EDUCATION:
B.S. /B.A environmental science/engineering, safety/industrial hygiene or other related scientific discipline;
M.S. or MBA preferred
EXPERIENCE:
15+ years of experience working in corporate sustainability/responsibility and EHS management in a large global organization.
Extensive knowledge of EHS and product stewardship regulations, best practices and EHS management systems, including experience engaging with regulators.
Ability to lead large teams, develop talent and increase capabilities
Proven track record of influencing across an organization to stand up new programs and initiatives.
Business experience at the commercial unit or site level
Must be a solution-oriented team player who is capable of leading a team and working collaboratively across multiple businesses, regions and functions.
SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:
Extensive knowledge of EHS and product stewardship regulations, globally
Extensive knowledge of sustainability and ESG disclosure frameworks, including: CDP, TCFD, SBTi, SASB, and GRI
Excellent business acumen, communication and presentation skills
Experience influencing externally, and working with policy/advocacy teams
Ability to influence internal work systems and processes
Willing to travel domestically and internationally, as required
Primary Work Location
USA NJ - Franklin Lakes
Additional Locations
Work Shift

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Datacenter Technician (DCT).
Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.
Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.
With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.
Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action!
#COICareers #Buildthecloud #ChangetheWorld #WeSeeYou #RepresentationMatters
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
Responsibilities
As a successful Datacenter Technician, your success will be measured by:
Learning and living the One Microsoft culture and values. Lead through change by bringing clarity, generating energy, and delivering success.
Empowering a culture of safety and security in global datacenter operations by complying with CO+I’s safety programs and policies and completing compliance knowledge assessments.
Developing positive working relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders.
As a successful Datacenter Technician, your day-to-day work will include:
Supporting deployment of on-site datacenter physical infrastructure
Installing, replacing and troubleshooting Cables and Hardware
Handling data bearing devices (ex. Hard drives, solid state drives, etc.)
Working within a ticket-based environment
Movement of equipment using pallet jacks or other assisted lifting equipment.
As required, assisting the Datacenter Inventory and Asset Management Team (DIAT) with shipping/receiving and inventory management to address high work volumes.
Qualifications
Microsoft reviews all applications that meet the below Required Qualifications.
For this role, you are welcome to apply if you meet the following Required Qualifications:
High School Diploma or equivalent
Basic knowledge of computer hardware and components
Six (6) months or more handling/maintaining any technical equipment or machinery.
While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:
1+ years’ experience supporting IT equipment or related technology.
Applicable certifications: CompTIA (A+, Server+, Network+), Basic Structure Cabling (BSC).
Ability to support frequent standing, walking, lifting, and working at heights with or without equipment assistance.
Able to communicate effectively.
Proficient in written and oral English communication to support regional and global teams.
Desire to learn, grow, and develop new technical skills.
Flexibility to work non-standard business hours that may include weekends and/or holidays.

Citizenship Verification: This position requires verification of US Citizenship to meet federal government security requirements.
Criminal Justice Information Services: This position may require passing a background check conducted through the CJIS criminal justice information system by authorized local, state, and/or federal agencies.

job_descriptions: BR-09 Research Intern, Environmental Degradation and Human Rights in Supply ChainsOverview: WWF OverviewFor 60 years, WWF has worked to help people and nature thrive. As one of the world’s leading conservation organizations, WWF works in more than 100 countries, connecting cutting-edge conservation science with the collective power of our partners in the field – more than one million supporters in the United States and five million globally, as well as partnerships with communities, companies, and governments.Our vision for diversity, equity and inclusion at WWF is an organization as diverse as the world we help protect; where the richness of all our unique views, experiences, and backgrounds combine to create the most sustainable and inclusive conservation outcomes possible — bringing the greatest benefit to the planet and every person who lives on it.Across the many cultures and individuals that represent WWF, we are unified by one mission, one brand, and one common set of values: Courage, Respect, Integrity and Collaboration.*Internships at WWF*WWF’s internship program vision is to recruit professionals early in their careers who bring fresh thinking and innovation to the environmental and conservation sector and are well positioned to develop into the next generation of leaders. Our mission is to increase exposure of students from underrepresented populations to conservation and environmental careers, provide professional development opportunities, reduce the barriers to attracting a diverse pool of internship candidates, and develop a pipeline for future WWF hires from underrepresented populations.*Position Summary*World Wildlife Fund (WWF), one of the world’s leading conservation organizations, seeks a Research Intern, Environmental Degradation and Human Rights in Supply Chains for the Markets Institute to examine the connections between environmental degradation & human rights violations.*Internship Description*The Markets Institute at WWF is a thought leadership platform committed to identifying global issues and emerging trends that affect the most critical threat to our finite planet - the production and consumption of food. Our goal is to increase the speed and scale of solutions that make a more sustainable future possible.This position will be researching one of the current major trends impacting both nature, people, and our global food system—the relationship and interlinkages between environmental degradation and human rights abuses and violations that occur along supply chains, resulting from global food and soft commodity production. The person will also examine and document how climate change may continue to exacerbate or alter these issues.Responsibilities:ResearchAnalysis and synthesisDocumentationCommunication skillsLearning Outcomes and ProductsImproved understanding of the connection of environmental degradation and human rights violationsDocumentation of specific current and historical instances where this has occurred and the reasons for the connection in each instance when possibleIdentification of individuals and institutions that are working on this topic and the creation of a network to engage them further on the issueAssessment of the most useful research and analysis skills and research tools that are important for this workDeeper understanding of both environmental, social, and supply chain issuesAbility to collate a set of reference cases and draw larger lessons and conclusions from themSynthesis and writing skillsQualifications:Pursuing either an Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree program in natural resources and environmental issues, sustainability, international development, political science, international relations, economics, and/or other similar fields.Excellent research skillsAttention to detailOrganized and self-motivatedStrong written and verbal communication skillsIdentifies and aligns with the core values of the WWF organization: Courage, Integrity, Respect & Collaboration*Location: *US Remote – WWF employs interns in all states with the exception of: Alabama, Arkansas, Hawaii, Idaho, Indiana, Iowa, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, Nevada, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Oklahoma, Rhode Island, Wisconsin, Wyoming.*Compensation: *Paid - $15 per hour (35 hours per week)One time stipend – net $100*How to apply: * Submit cover letter and resume through our Careers Page, Requisition #BR-09. Application deadline by May 19th, 2021 PM EST. If selected for the role, you will need to provide 2 letters of recommendation as part of the WWF application process.*Please note that intern must have U.S. work authorization that does not require sponsorship of a visa.*As an EOE/AA employer, WWF will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, or protected Veteran status.*Location: 1250 24th St. NW, Washington, DC 20037Job Type: Internship

ISC is seeking a dynamic Program Officer to support the design and implementation of equitable resilience and sustainability programs and projects that advance and accelerate equitable climate solutions. Working across a variety of U.S geographies, the position supports locally-led solutions that tackle immediate challenges while strengthening communities overall. Examples of current ISC programs include: the Partnership for Resilient Communities, Climate Change, Health & Equity and Regional Climate Solutions, and other ISC initiatives. In conjunction with other ISC team members, community organizations and advocates, philanthropic, governmental and institutional stakeholders, the Program Officer engages in collaborative and data-driven planning, design, and implementation of programs.
More specifically, the Program Officer will:
Participate as a member of a program team in the development, implementation and support of ISC programs.
Serve as point-of-contact with multiple partners, ensuring that ISC is tracking the progress of partners, providing capacity and technical assistance support, assessing partner needs, capturing best practices and lessons learned, and helping disseminate those practices and lessons.
Conduct assigned research and develop resources, tools, case studies and other materials to support program deliverables, including identifying technical assistance and capacity-building resources and approaches.
Assist in the development and delivery of events, including designing sessions, identifying speakers, and facilitating meetings, workshops, and convenings.
Disseminate program materials to partners and participants.
Develop maps, charts and graphs and other data illustrations.
Develop and/or co-author grant reports, final program reports and other written documents.
Assist with the development and implementation of communications strategies and materials including case studies, newsletter articles, blogs, etc.
Assist with new program proposal development.
Maintain a working knowledge of program budgets.
Requirements
ISC is committed to addressing structural racism and income inequality in the US that undermines efforts to build strong communities and regions prepared to respond to climate change. The ideal candidate will hold and have demonstrated actions illustrating the same commitment and values, including experience interacting and working with diverse communities, neighborhoods, and populations most vulnerable to the impacts of climate related events, and experience working directly with and for communities and for organizations working to address and overcome systemic racism and the multitude of adverse outcomes that result.
Additionally, ISC seeks a dynamic professional who demonstrates the following attributes:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related area
Five to seven years of professional experience in a relevant field such as: environmental sustainability, urban planning, environmental justice, climate resilience or adaptation; public health; transportation; housing; economic development; or workforce development
Experience serving underrepresented communities, neighborhoods, and populations most vulnerable to the impacts of climate related events
Experience working directly with and for communities of color to address and overcome systemic racism and the multitude of adverse outcomes that result.
Ability to work productively with diverse individuals from differing backgrounds (government, private sector, advocacy, social profit organizations, and community-based organizations)
Direct experience working with the non-profit sector and/or city/regional government, preferably focused on social/racial justice, public health, environmental justice, equitable development and/or climate change adaptation and resilience issues
Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills
Direct experience in stakeholder engagement; facilitation experience valued, but not required
Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively as a positive and contributing team member
Strong research and analytical skills
Strong work ethic and personal integrity
Flexibility and willingness to adapt to changing priorities and ability to meet deadlines
Proficient in use of Microsoft Office including Excel, Power Point; Google Suite and Google applications; ESRI/GIS, and other software
Experience in presenting and communicating research/data to varying levels within the organization and/or stakeholders
Willingness and ability to travel
Commitment to the ISC mission and goals
Position Scope
This position will work from a fully virtual/home office. Some domestic travel is required (up to 30%). All travel currently on hold due to Covid-19.
ISC is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workplace. People from diverse racial, ethnic and cultural backgrounds, women, LGBTQ+ individuals, and persons with disabilities are highly encouraged to apply.

Our mission at The Boston Beer Company is to bring the highest-quality products to the U.S. beer drinker. To answer that mission, we are creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the differences in both our people and our brands. Our diversity makes us stronger, and when you bring your authentic self to work, we are a stronger, more innovative, and more sustainable company & community.
As a fast-paced, growing company with a strong family of brands (Samuel Adams, Dogfish Head, Angry Orchard, Twisted Tea, and Truly Hard Seltzer), we seek constantly to challenge the status quo. We are always looking for hardworking, talented, and passionate people (that means you!) to join our team.
We are The Boston Beer Company, and together we are heavy.
We are currently hiring a Senior Manager, Environmental Sustainability in Boston, MA or Remote.
Boston Beer is looking for a passionate and experienced Senior Manager to support the building and implementation of BBC’s environmental sustainability strategy. The sustainability role sits within BBC’s broader EHSS group and the People & Culture team.
Together with the Director, EHS the Senior Manager, Environmental Sustainability will ensure that BBC designs and implements a cohesive environmental sustainability strategy. In collaboration with our Social Impact team, Supply Chain, Sales, Office and our Local Brewery & Taproom teams, understand current practices at each facility; the requirements and limitations, and identify strategic opportunities to operate more sustainably while ensuring compliance with local requirements. Understanding, articulating, and measuring BBCs sustainability footprint – from our Supplier’s Supplier to our Customer’s customer reflects the scope and breadth of the role.
You will be results-oriented focused who is comfortable working in an extremely dynamic and changing environment. The ability to tackle immediate problems while keeping an eye toward longer-term game-changing solutions will enable you to thrive in this position.
You will identify key strategic priorities for BBC, associated operational goals and provide leadership to ensure that goals, objectives, and commitments are consistently met or exceeded. You will collaborate with a diverse team from across the organization to create and drive innovative sustainability programs.

What You'll Do:
Partner across the BBC organization to define sustainability ambition, along with cohesive strategy to achieve
Oversee evaluation of existing utilities/processes (water, electricity, natural gas, CO2, effluent, chemicals) for consumption rates and costs for the purposes of identifying improvement opportunities
Develop process improvements and recommend vendors to implement new programs to close the opportunity gaps and secure environmentally beneficial reuse and recycle solutions that include complete training and communication procedures.
Forecast and set quarterly goals for sustainability efforts once benchmarking is complete, recommending short and long term goals for each segment of the organization, including tracking and reporting on KPIs to demonstrate the connection between sustainability initiatives against strategic goals
Negotiate and manage contracts with outside vendors to support BBC network
Manage/Monitor Gensuite Sustainability software platform launch in collaboration with EHSS team
Be the SME on Waste Reduction and related topics and participate in company-wide working groups and conversations related to Waste Reduction to build relationships and drive change
Support Corporate EHS compliance team with future audits in the recycling chain, ensuring that all steps meet or exceed regulatory and contractual performance requirements where appropriate
Engage in industry associations and partnerships to expand knowledge base and opportunities in the evolving sustainability solutions universe
Champion the work of the Boston Beer Co coworker network focused on Sustainability, helping to guide and support their work
Partner with the Social Impact Team to further engage coworkers; creating learning opportunities; build BBC sustainability presence; tie effort to brand/marketing efforts
Create and deliver Sustainability policies, procedures and reports that capture a holistic effort across the BBC network that can be shared both internally and externally
Be a lead in helping each part of the BBC organization celebrate and promote our sustainability story; goals and outcomes
Drive materiality assessments and other internal and external benchmarking initiatives
Coordinate sustainability reporting process across all relevant functions and external vendors; work closely with internal stakeholders to include sustainability topics in external communications
Research and recommend for consideration potential partnerships, memberships and organizational commitments related to sustainability

What We're Looking For:
B.A/B.S in Environmental Studies/Sustainability Management or Engineering/Facility Management or related fields
7+ years experience in related position, taking leadership is a bonus
Previous experience working in a dynamic environment, with multi-sectors (sales, retail, manufacturing)
Shared passion with our sustainability purpose
Excellent communicator who is capable of influencing and motivating others, collaborating with diverse groups across a large organization, and with external partners
Travel up to 25% of the time
Experience navigating complex environments; recommending solutions to problems while exercising good judgement
A data-driven nature, and attention to detail that drive your love of process improvement
Self-motivated, energetic, and driven with the drive to learn new skills
Strong business acumen and Microsoft proficient
Can quickly understand and communicate environmental concepts and challenges across a wide range of audiences
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Professional confidence and credibility to effectively engage and influence mid-senior level management

Some Perks:
Our people are our most important “ingredient.” We not only have to hire the best, but we have to reward, develop, and retain them too. We also have a variety of benefits including a competitive compensation package, extensive training programs, excellent healthcare, a discounted stock purchase plan, and a 401K program with a generous company match. Not to mention, there’s the free beer too!
Boston Beer Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to help ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veteran’s Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants who wish to request accommodation in the job application process can contact jobs@bostonbeer.com for assistance.

Job Summary

The University of Michigan School of Education’s Center for Education Design, Evaluation, and Research (CEDER) is hiring a Program Assistant to work across two STEM and sustainability education programs administered by the center: the Bosch Eco+ STEM Teacher Grant Program, and the Dow Innovation Teacher Fellowship. The Program Assistant will work directly with the BEST Teacher Grant Program Manager and the Dow Innovation Teacher Fellowship Program Coordinator. This position reports to the Managing Director for CEDER, Nate Phipps.

Starting date: As soon as possible. Please note this is a term-limited position ending on June 30, 2022, with the opportunity of renewal.

Who We Are

CEDER

The Center for Education Design, Evaluation, and Research (CEDER) advances equity and excellence in education by providing access to high-quality design, evaluation, and research services through collaborations with university, school, and community partners. CEDER, a center within the University of Michigan School of Education, provides expertise on topics relating to teaching, learning, leadership, and policy at multiple levels of education.

The BEST Teacher Grant Program and Dow Teacher Innovation Fellowship are partnership programs administered by CEDER.


Responsibilities*

The Program Assistant will work with program and administrative staff within CEDER to accomplish the goals of the position. You will be responsible for program administration across four main areas: program outreach and event logistics, fellowship and grant administration, teacher support and resource curation, and development of the DITF Youth Sustainability Fellowship Program. The BEST and DITF programs are growing and evolving, and the opportunity to work on other projects and tasks may arise for you.

The ideal candidate will feel passionate about sustainability, education, and educational equity.

Program Outreach & Event Logistics

Maintain contact lists using administrative software
Technical and administrative assistance for online events

Help with registration and logistics for in-person gatherings
Administer social media page for Dow Innovation Teacher Fellowship

Fellowship & Grant Administration

Create new online accounts for grant applicants
Administer of application review processes
Disburse of grant funds
Administer of the grantee and fellow reporting process

Teacher Support & Resource Curation

Create and review of program resources
Maintain a database of teacher resources
Communicate resources and opportunities to teachers

DITF Youth Sustainability Fellowship Program

Help With program planning and implementation
Ensure Children on Campus guidelines are followed when engaging with minors

CEDER Administrative Support

Provide support to other CEDER projects and programs
Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications*

An earned bachelor’s degree in teaching, educational studies, program administration, or related fields, or commensurate professional experience;
2+ years experience with program and/or project administration or commensurate professional experience;

As Sustainability Coordinator, you will help to coordinate and execute program day-to-day activities including sustainability reporting, chain of custody (COC) documentation, customer response support, data collection, and product/project support. Populate data logs through coordination with cross functional teams.

Support Sustainability Program Manager in coordinating internal communications with various stakeholder groups

Superior verbal and written communication skills
Inquisitive, enjoys learning
Self-motivated

ERM is seeking a motivated and dynamic Sustainability Strategy & Disclosure Consultant to join our growing sustainability advisory services practice area in Cleveland . In this entry-level, client-facing role, you will work directly with senior consultants to provide support on client engagements such as materiality assessments, writing sustainability reports, responding to ESG (environmental, social and governance) ratings and rankings, and setting sustainability goals.
This is an excellent opportunity for a junior professional looking to work with an expert consulting team on interesting ESG projects for a wide range of Fortune 500 and privately held clients—helping them achieve positive and tangible social, environmental, and economic impact.
RESPONSIBILITIES :
Conduct desk-based benchmarking and research on clients, industries, and market trends.
Analyze client documentation and identify improvement opportunities (gap analysis).
Synthesize research findings into key themes, analyze information to develop conclusions and draft recommendations for client deliverables.
Prepare client deliverables.
Support the development of corporate sustainability reports, including outlining, writing, editing, and proofreading content and other client communications.
Participate in client meetings and workshops and maintain required documentation.
Assist in general business development research, marketing, and other development tasks.
Support ERM Partners-in-Charge and Project Managers to effectively manage projects.
REQUIREMENTS :
Bachelor’s degree required, with Master’s degree in relevant field a plus. We consider a broad range of undergraduate majors and advanced degrees.
Recent graduate to 3 years of related experience in consulting, corporate, industrial or other environment.
Demonstrated critical thinking and analytical skills.
Superb written and oral communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills to interface effectively within multiple levels of consulting staff and client personnel.
Penchant for service excellence and a collaborative style.
Ability to multi-task, maintain flexibility, travel, and work independently. Some travel is required to support a wide array of projects and clients.
High level proficiency in use of Microsoft Office programs—comfort with complicated Excel formulas, pivot tables, etc., plus ability to present information succinctly and visually in
PowerPoint; sophisticated data analysis a plus.
Demonstrated interest in business consulting and environmental/social issues (through related coursework, previous employment, or personal endeavors).
Who We Are:
As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. ERM and our partners are driven by a dynamic vision: By 2021 we will be the clear leader in our chosen markets, we will double in value and we will deliver on our promises to our clients, our people and our investors. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.

Summary:

At Epsten Group, we pride ourselves on being a pioneer for sustainability in the built environment. Sustainability is in our DNA– it’s the right thing to do for future generations and the legacy we leave behind. We maintain the front-line of sustainability, spreading the word globally and investing locally. We are a JUST Label company with a focus on social equity in how we operate our business, as well as the health and well-being of our employees through our WELL and Fitwel certifications.

Industry pioneers to our core, we push the boundaries by walking many clients through their own firsts. Our services remain flexible to meet the growing demand for a sustainable, healthier future. Our team strives to create a global impact surrounding green initiatives and maintains a company culture that reflects this. We celebrate diversity, inclusion, and equity and have recruited top talent from all over the globe. With office flexibility and a work-life balance, we accommodate individual preferences, believing that freedom, respect, and creativity lead to happiness and prosperity.

We are seeking a full-time Senior Sustainability Specialist to provide technical expertise for projects pursuing LEED BD+C, ID+C, and O+M rating systems; WELL v1, v2, and WELL Health-Safety Rating; SITES v2.0; and TRUE Zero Waste certification. Both Reviewer and Consulting work for projects attempting the same rating systems, as well as Parksmart, Fitwel, and Living Building Challenge will apply. We are looking for an energetic, fast learner who is detail-oriented to join our growing company based in Atlanta, Georgia.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in a field of study related to one or more of the following specialties: Architecture (architecture, construction, landscape architecture, interior design) Engineering (mechanical, civil, structural), Policy, or Environmental Studies
LEED AP with specialty required
Professional accreditation in additional rating systems preferred: WELL AP, WELL Performance Testing Agent, SITES AP, TRUE Advisor, Parksmart Advisor, or Fitwel Ambassador
Ability to read, understand and interpret building floor plans, sections, site plans, construction specifications, mechanical schedules, commissioning reports and operational policies preferred
Detailed technical understanding of and experience with one or more of the following building operations topics: common construction methods, materials specification, fenestration, HVAC systems, plumbing systems, electrical systems, landscape design, master planning, land use, zoning, urban development preferred
Bi-lingual fluency in Portuguese, Chinese, Spanish, French, or Arabic a plus

Other Required Skills and Qualifications:

Understanding of the WELL rating system including forms, calculations, and documentation requirements, including how to apply WELL criteria to the review of documentation for verification. Performance Verification Testing training will be required.
Understanding of the SITES rating system including forms, calculations, and documentation requirements, including how to apply SITES criteria to the review of documentation for verification.
Understanding of the TRUE rating system including forms, calculations, and documentation requirements, including how to apply TRUE criteria to the review of documentation for verification.
Understanding of the LEED-NC rating system including forms, calculations, and documentation requirements, including how to apply LEED criteria to the review of documentation for verification. Training on additional rating systems included as skills increase.
Provide written comments explaining the results of the review; all review work is completed as a part of a team.
Certification Reviewers are expected to graduate to Senior Reviewer level and serve as Consulting Specialists and eventually Project Managers for Consulting projects after the initial training period.

About the Entry-level Sustainability Specialist Role

Essential Functions:

Perform in-depth technical review and analyses of building design, construction, and operations for compliance with LEED rating systems on time with high quality to gain rating system proficiency with the goal of achieving Senior status within one year.
Educate and directly engage the marketplace by effectively communicating through written, verbal, and in-person meetings with project teams and owners
Provide technical customer service support to project teams
Contribute to the continued development and increased technical knowledge of fellow LEED Certification Reviewers through collaborative teamwork
Understanding of the LEED-NC and/or WELL rating system including forms, calculations, and documentation requirements, including how to apply LEED and/or WELL criteria to the review of documentation for verification.
Opportunity to learn more about the SITES, TRUE, Fitwel, and Living Building Challenge rating system, including forms, calculations, documentation requirements, and how to apply the criteria to a project or the review of documentation for verification

Essential Functions After Initial Training Period:

Contribute to a project’s pursuit of a sustainability-related certification by working as the Project Manager, guiding the project team through the entire certification process, from Strategic Development through Certification Award, possibly beyond Award for Recertification
Complete all necessary forms, annotations, and documentation required to document fulfillment of the rating system requirements
Wherever possible, EGI Project Managers do not rely on the documentation to be completed by other project team members, with obvious exceptions in the form of project drawings or engineering calculations
Perform in-depth technical review and analyses of building design, construction, and operations for compliance with LEED rating systems on time with high quality
Perform quality assurance (QA) review of work done by other Reviewers
Participate in Business Development activities such as networking, speaking engagements, and written content for marketing purposes

Metrics for Success:

Achieve Senior Specialist status within one year
Meet individual review production metrics (quality, efficiency, and timeliness)
Achieve customer service satisfaction consistent with department goals
Demonstrate professional growth by advancing foundational and leadership competencies

Epsten Group offers employees a comprehensive benefits package with competitive salaries and more including:

Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance
Health Savings Account
401(k) with company match
Paid Personal Leave
Paid Holidays
Alternative Commuter Benefits
Health Club Reimbursements
Employee Referral Bonuses

If interested, please send a resume and cover letter to apply@epstengroup.com.

job_title: Refugee Center Sustainability & Development AmeriCorps VISTA
job_descriptions:
Refugee Center Sustainability & Development AmeriCorps VISTA



Do you want to boost your skills in research and assessment, marketing, and program management to the next level? Do you aspire to combine your professional background with a desire to uplift your community and empower others to attain self-sufficiency? If so, this is the perfect opportunity for you! The Refugee Center Sustainability and Development VISTA will build the capacity of the Utah Refugee Education and Training Center’s (URETC) programming through developing sustainable marketing and reporting plans, improving existing data tracking systems, and establishing new lasting partnerships to support center programs, workshops, and services. This will allow more refugee clients to gain the skills and expertise needed to place them in better paying jobs, support their families, and lift their communities out of poverty. The ideal candidate will have skills in problem-solving, organization, project management. They must be eager to learn best-practices in community needs assessment, program development, and community outreach. Most importantly, they must have a passion for and willingness to learn more about creating stronger community programming through providing data-driven results.. The Refugee Center Sustainability & Development AmeriCorps VISTA is one of eleven AmeriCorps VISTA members involved in the Utah Refugee VISTA Project (URVP). Our VISTAs serve at eight sites across the Salt Lake Valley, but still work closely with one another. URVP VISTAs can expect professional development, mentorship, and support from AmeriCorps and their host organizations. Serving in Salt Lake City, there is always something new to do! From international film festivals to cultural celebrations and abundant access to year-round outdoor recreation, there's something for everyone. Please reach out to Kira DeLong, our VISTA Leader, at kdelong@utah.gov with any questions about the position, AmeriCorps VISTA, or the Utah Refugee VISTA Project at large.








Member Duties : Tasks include: Implementing new program monitoring and evaluation tools and ensure viability/sustainability with RSO practices, recommending improvements and carry forward changes as necessary, developing monitoring and evaluation tools for various programs across RSO, designing capstone projects for URC’s training and education programs, and developing a sustainable marketing plan for the Utah Refugee Center.


Program Benefits : Training , Education award upon successful completion of service , Health Coverage* , Living Allowance , Stipend , Childcare assistance if eligible , Choice of Education Award or End of Service Stipend , Relocation Allowance .



For details about AmeriCorps VISTA healthcare benefits, please visit http://www.vistacampus.gov/healthcare


Terms :

Permits working at another job during off hours , Permits attendance at school during off hours , Car recommended .


Service Areas :

Community and Economic Development , Education .


Skills :

Team Work , Community Organization , Public Speaking , Communications , Writing/Editing , Computers/Technology , Non-Profit Management , Leadership , Social Services .

AmeriCorps VISTA

Our purpose at Molson Coors Beverage Company is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world.

We are TalentBrewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate self-starters who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So if you get fired up about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do then we want to hear from you.

The Headlines:
In the role of Environmental and Sustainability Engineer working in Fort Worth, TX, you will be part of the Technical Services team. You will lead local execution of environmental aspects of the Environmental, Health, and Safety Strategy and drive day-to-day environmental compliance.

You will collaborate and interface with external stakeholders to obtain and maintain necessary permits, understand impacts of pending regulation, and enhance MillerCoors community reputation. You will coach others to drive plant engagement in environmental and regulatory compliance and lead the Sustainability Employee Council and represent the brewery on the Environmental Council.

The Responsibilities:
Ensure compliance with all environmental regulationsFacilitate environmental incident investigationsMonitor progress of environmental improvement programsAssess the existing or potential environmental impact of land use projects on air, water and landIdentify environmental, energy saving, and renewable energy projectsDevelop, implement, and manage plans/programs related to landfill-free effortsSupport key safety programs such as process safety management/risk management, radiation safety, asbestos management, and emergency responseCoach operational teams on improving environmental performanceLead active environmental related teams and engagement activities

The Other Qualifications:
Possess a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Environmental Science or related technical degreeYou have at least 5 years of work experience in an environmental field in a manufacturing environmentPrevious experience with implementing water and energy reduction and waste/recycling programsAdvanced familiarity with federal and state environmental rules and regulationsAbility to lead volunteer and mandated team effortsProficient in the use of incident investigation and problem solving methodologiesAbility to analyze data, recognize business impact and communicate trends

Work Perks that You Need to Know About:
As the world’s family brewer we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globeWe play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we areYou can become a Certified Beer Enthusiast through in-house training that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairingsAccess to cool brand clothing and swag, top events, beer allotment, an Employee Assistance Program and discount plansParticipation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental and other benefitsWork within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences

At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.

Nearest Major Market: Fort Worth

Nearest Secondary Market: Dallas

job_title: Assistant Vice President, Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) & Sustainability
job_descriptions:
Job Title: Assistant Vice President, Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) & Sustainability
Location: New York Headquarters – 10 Hudson Yards, New York, NY
BACKGROUND ON L’OREAL USA
L'Oréal USA is the largest subsidiary of the L'Oréal Group, the world’s leading beauty company. L’Oréal USA manages a portfolio of more than 30 iconic beauty brands, including Garnier, Giorgio Armani Beauty, Kérastase, Lancôme, La Roche-Posay, L’Oréal Paris and Yves Saint Laurent Beauté. L’Oréal USA also serves as the international hub for the product development and marketing strategy for L’Oréal’s 16 American brands: Baxter of California, Carol’s Daughter, Clarisonic, Dermablend, Essie, IT Cosmetics, Kiehl’s, Matrix, Maybelline New York, Mizani, NYX, Ralph Lauren Fragrances, Redken, Softsheen-Carson, SkinCeuticals and Urban Decay. Generating more than $6 billion in sales annually, L’Oréal USA is committed to growth through sustainable innovation, driven by the company’s Sharing Beauty with All ambition for sustainable development across the Group’s value chain. The company is headquartered in New York City, employs more than 10,000 people, and operates administrative, research, manufacturing and distribution facilities across 13 states, including Arkansas, California, Florida, Kentucky, New Jersey, Ohio, Texas and Washington.
BACKGROUND ON SHARING BEAUTY WITH ALL
L’Oréal’s company-wide sustainability program, Sharing Beauty with All, was launched in 2013. The program is L’Oréal’s approach to meeting the environmental & social challenges of the future and adopting low-carbon, socially-inclusive business practices. The company’s commitments under Sharing Beauty with All have clear targets for 2020 which cover every rung of the L’Oréal’s value chain: manufacturing, supply chain, ingredient sourcing, formulation, packaging, marketing, etc. Every subsidiary, including L’Oréal USA, has to define and conduct a strategy to meet the commitments locally and contribute towards achieving the global targets.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIESDefine Sharing Beauty with All sustainability goals, strategy and implementation plan for the U.S. market across all divisions and functions of the business.Serve as the Director of L’Oréal USA’s sustainability governance structure and manage the strategic and day-to-day operations of governing body, including implementation of US action plan.Act as the intermediary between Global Chief Sustainability Officer and global Sharing Beauty with All project team at headquarters and L’Oréal USA’s Chief Communications Officer and senior management in order to define the proper implementation of the global strategy locally, identify & define local opportunities and milestones, resolve global/local differences in terms of success metrics, implementation and organization.Report sustainability progress & updates to U.S., and international management and business leaders and provide recommendations whenever there are issues hindering progress.Collaborate with brands on sustainability pilot programs, support the translation of sustainability into brand strategies and marketing plans, and provide thought leadership on brand philanthropic strategy, cause marketing campaigns and social innovation more broadly.Inspire innovation by collecting and communicating sustainability best practices from Operations, R&I, HR and the brands both internally and externally.Contribute to strategic conversations and special projects with external stakeholders (NGOs, trade associations, business partners) related to the topic of sustainability.Raise L’Oréal’s sustainability profile and thought leadership through participation in external sustainability organizations, working groups and events.Work with the heads of External Communications & Internal Communications in the U.S. to identify opportunities to communicate milestones, achievements and leadership moments to key audiences related to Sharing Beauty with All program.Work with the Learning for Development department and Internal Communications to convene, educate, train and motivate employees to meet 2020 goals.Work with the head of Public Affairs to manage public-affairs related sustainability and CSR issues, including engaging in government relations activities.Serve as main internal and external spokesperson on the topic of sustainability and L’Oréal’s Sharing Beauty with All program.

KEY COMPETENCIESProject management skills for all phases of Sharing Beauty with All: initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and controlling the commitmentsA strong command of change management theory and practice; provide both the structure and the tools needed to manage and realize change successfully on the technical and people sideAn ability to identify the specific challenges of streamlining Sharing Beauty with All within L’Oréal USA and finding ways to facilitate the process and create a common culture of sustainabilityInterest and curiosity for technical topics around sustainability (such as life cycle analysis, renewable energies, the sourcing of ingredients, sustainable packaging design)Ability to work in tandem with local U.S. teams & management, as well the Sharing Beauty with All leadership in Paris and international expertsAbility to help brands translate L’Oréal’s Sharing Beauty with All commitments into marketing strategiesIdentify the best external partners and multi-stakeholders to leverage to help L’Oréal USA accelerate its Sharing Beauty with All activitiesAn entrepreneurial and initiative-taking spirit. Ability to seize unique opportunities in the U.S. landscape to engage L’Oréal USA on sustainability and to build its sustainability reputationSpokesperson skills and ease at stakeholder relations

What We're AboutAerion is on a mission to revolutionize global mobility by building the next generation of high-speed global transportation networks. We are committed to a vibrant and connected world where distance is no longer a barrier, and to innovation that is kind to our planet. Working at Aerion is so much more than building the world’s first carbon-neutral supersonic aircraft – it’s about bringing humanity closer together.The return of supersonic flight is not without its obstacles. Aviation sustainability will take the increased relevance in a world that has placed environmental impact as a priority. Your role is to continue developing and executing the sustainability strategy as well as overseeing implementation of sustainable initiatives which will continue to make Aerion an industry leader in environmental stewardship. We anticipate hiring this role Summer 2021 to our Melbourne, FL location.On any given day you might: Lead the implementation of the sustainability strategy across all the different areas and functions of the organization at a local and global levelTake ownership of the implementation of specific LCA (Life Cycle Assessment) methodology throughout the organization, ensuring sustainability targets are metContribute to the LCA assessment and definition of carbon targets for components and subassemblies form Tier 1 supplier’s products in line with the Aerion’s overall Sustainability PlanKeep track of industry trends relevant to sustainability and define implementation strategiesDraft the annual sustainability report and reporting on Aerion’s sustainability activity to different audiences including investors, suppliers, customers, and company employeesConstant communication with the AS2 teams will be critical in understanding the technical status and outlook of the sustainability goalsBe part of a team writing proposals for government programs/grantsWe're looking for someone who hasBS in engineering, chemistry, environmental Science or other relevant disciplineMS in engineering, chemistry, environmental Science or other relevant discipline desired10+ years of experience in the sustainability areaAbility to plan and program own work and that of othersAbility to delegate to others, and to provide appropriate and timely feedbackFamiliarity with ISO 14000 EMS standards is desiredFamiliarity with project engineering and managementLet's Build a Company TogetherWe are looking for creative, courageous pioneers and innovators; people that are committed to having a profound impact on our world. We are looking for people who believe in a bold vision and can back it up with successful execution. People that love the beauty of flight and are deeply committed to protecting our planet. People that have unquestionable integrity and are committed to building a company the world can trust, and products that our customers know are safe.Job Type: Full-time

ISS Corporate Solutions help companies design and manage their corporate governance, executive compensation, and sustainability programs to align with company goals, reduce risk, and manage the needs of a diverse shareholder base by delivering best-in-class data, tools, and advisory services.
Every day, more publicly traded companies are developing and refining disclosures around their environmental and social practices, impacts, and risks. These companies seek expert guidance on industry norms and best practices, shareholder expectations, and external ratings systems like ISS’ Environmental & Social QualityScore.
The Sustainability Operations Associate role on the ICS team is a critical role that provides expert support for our advisory services on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues to senior executives at the world’s largest companies. The successful candidate will work both independently as well as collaboratively with ISS Corporate Solutions (ICS) Advisors to provide sustainability content and advisory services, and will work on client-facing projects in tandem with ICS personnel in the United States and Europe. We put great emphasis on cooperation and offer a welcoming, collegial working atmosphere.
In this role, you will create and produce client reports, support client engagement, work on special data collection projects, and collaborate with the other members of the ICS sustainability advisory team on other initiatives as needed.
Most of our sustainability work involves helping companies optimize their public environmental and social disclosures. Using ISS ESG data and other resources, we create and deliver numerous reports and datasets for clients. In this role, you would:
Work closely with U.S. colleagues to support several facets of our client work, including preparation of sustainability disclosures and ISS ratings scenario analysis
Generate and quality-check client reports and other deliverables
Help develop and implement new client deliverables as our scope of work increases
Develop expertise on ISS ESG data and consider new ways to utilize it for our clients
Qualifications
Degree in Business, Sustainability, or a related field with an exceptional performance record
Demonstrated knowledge of corporate sustainability concepts (sustainability work experience a plus)
Technical comfort (including the ability to quickly learn and train on customized computer applications, and develop a familiarity with ISS databases)
Effective time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
Ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues in the U.S. and Europe, generally by email
Excellent organization, multitasking, and prioritization skills
Strong Excel, PowerPoint, or SQL skills
Intellectual curiosity and ability to master complex concepts and technical subject matter quickly
Extreme attention to detail and ability to turn to others for assistance when required
#LI-AA1
ISS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with the Veteran and Disability Acts.

JOB TITLE: SUSTAINABILITY COORDINATOR We are looking for a sustainability coordinator who will help aid Verdani Partners with incorporating corporate sustainability programs and policies for each of our clients. They will directly help our President and Directors of Sustainability in implementing policies in organizations with diversified, national and international portfolios of buildings. This full-time position will begin with an intense 3-6 month training period. The candidate must be willing to work onsite at our Carlsbad office. Preference will be given to candidates that have some educational training and experience with commercial real estate and/or corporate sustainability.This applicant would coordinate directly with the clients; therefore, they must also have superior communication, writing and presentation skills. This is an entry level position that will require a training course which Verdani Partners will be providing.See additional company information below in the “about us” section or visit our careers page to learn more about our firm.QUALIFICATIONS Required: Bachelor’s Degree, Majors: Architecture, Environmental Studies, Engineering, Business AdminPreferred: Master’s DegreeLEED Green Associate or LEED Accredited Professional - EBOM, EITSKILLS & EXPERIENCERequired: Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as graphic communication skillsAbility to adapt to meet the needs of clients and the companyExperience with general office software applications (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)Interest in becoming an expert in corporate sustainabilityAbility to learn on the jobPreferred: Commercial Real Estate ExperienceCorporate Sustainability ExperienceEnergy Star Portfolio ManagerLEED Existing Buildings Operation & Maintenance (EBOM)LANGUAGES Fluent in English speaking and writingADDITIONAL DETAILSThis is a 40hr/week entry level position with an expectation of at least a 1yr+ commitment.The employee for this position will go through an intense training period. While this is an entry level position, there is vast potential for growth within Verdani Partners.Verdani is an equal opportunity employer.Applicant must either be local to Carlsbad, CA USA or willing to relocate/commute there.Due to COVID-19, applicant will temporarily work remotely.If you have a LinkedIn profile, please include a link to it with your resume. If you are a recent graduate, please include a list of your key classes.We encourage you to research Verdani Partners online at: Verdani.com, Facebook, LinkedIn and TwitterThank you for your interest in this position at Verdani Partners!ABOUT VERDANI PARTNERSVerdani is a mission driven organization to advance sustainability in the build environment on a global scale. Our international team of experts believes in living and working with sound environmental and economic values. We specialize in greening new and existing large building portfolios and support corporate sustainability needs. Verdani Partners maintains a high level of technical and practical knowledge in real estate, building operations, energy analysis, sustainability reporting, codes, and green building certifications. Some of our key services are corporate sustainability, GRESB & GRI reporting, LEED Certifications, Energy Star Benchmarking, ASHRAE Audits, Commissioning and Education. Our approach is to identify and prioritize effective solutions that can be sustained over the life of the building, adding economic, social and environmental value along the way. Our talented team of experts rock the sustainability world with expertise, passion and an above-and-beyond commitment. We are laid back but very talented, professional and most of all, we like to make our work fun!**Due to the volume of applications that we receive, we are not able to give status updates on your application at this time.
