Global Commercial Sustainability Manager
Open to all GSK Locations
Are you an experienced & passionate Commercial Sustainability Manager who is looking for the opportunity to support driving direction and shape future success of sustainability?
GSK have a Global Commercial Sustainability Manager role for a on a full time permanent basis within the Global Consumer Healthcare Sustainability department and based in the UK at GSK House in Brentford. There is some working from home flexibility.
The Consumer Healthcare (CH) Sustainability team was setup in Sept 2019 with a mandate to understand the landscape and define a Sustainability strategy for GSK CH. Now that the environmental strategy has been formed, fast deployment is underway across the organisation and the draft social and economic strategy development is in progress, additional resource is required to support further iteration of the strategy and delivery thereof within the Commercial GSKCH organisation.
The key purpose of this role is to support the Global Commercial Sustainability Lead in the development of competitive, credible company commercial sustainability strategies and targets and turn them into plans, projects and actions to deliver CH Sustainability through category, brand and customer efforts.
This role will require working collaboratively with the CH Sustainability and extended Team, multiple commercial stakeholders, business functions and external partners. This role will therefore require complex stakeholder management and there may be specific projects that will be led by this role whereas in the case of some others, this role will partner and contribute.
The role is accountable for:
Providing strategic input, representing a view across Commercial Excellence and Marketing in order to develop a Commercial Sustainability Plan that is designed to embed sustainability in the commercial organisation, and which ensures that our sustainability efforts come to life through our brands, categories and customer partnerships.
Leading key projects in line with the Commercial Sustainability Plan
Strong cross-functional partnership with relevant commercial stakeholders and influence to drive the delivery of Sustainability action plans across the business and by category. These plans will be owned and executed by the regional, market and category teams and informed by the global company sustainability strategy.
Contributing to the continuous building of the Commerical Sustainability Capability Plan
Leading Content Development for -, executing and embedding key CH Commercial Sustainability capability and knowledge building initiatives to assure rapid delivery of the CH sustainability agenda through categories, brands and customer efforts.
Input into the GSKCH Strategic Narrative and support the delivery of key content assets that bring the narrative to life
Support the deployment of the GSKCH Sustainability Strategy across the commercial organisation in line with plan and through key commercial touchpoints
The role will contribute to the facilitation of Commercial Teams selection of business focused and holistic solutions that drive delivery and report back progress to CH Commercial Sustainability Lead.
Key Responsibilities
Support sustainability strategy development and delivery – translating the headline strategy into a simple narrative, infographic(s) and ‘how to guides’ etc. which can be easily cascaded across the business.
Work with different parts of the organisation to interpret the strategy for their area and develop plans to act on the strategy & goals – helping them set and prioritise their actions on sustainability whether that is by brand, category, region, area, local country or a key channel or customer
Help brands and lead design markets to develop their purpose into action plans and execute these brilliantly in key markets and with key customers
Input and contribute to the commercial roadmap development for the Consumer Healthcare Sustainability team, defining and getting alignment from key commercial partners on clear commercial roadmap of must win areas, including enablers, also informed by input from the Future Business Sustainability CH lead, design, marketing edge and commercial excellence.
Work with customer teams to develop plans to drive growth through sustainability – acting on key consumer, shopper trends and on sustainability needs and wants.
Build capability in Marketing, R&D and Customer teams in Sustainability – equipping teams with the knowledge, tools, processes needed to leverage sustainability as a lever for growth. Find ways to ‘bake in’ sustainability to how we do business, so that it becomes a natural part of how we develop category, brand, region, area, customer growth plans
Support the delivery of the Sustainability Community of Practice Initiative
Closing Date for Applications: Monday 17th May 2021
Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert.
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:
Degree qualified ideally in Commerce
Extensive experience and delivery in the Commercial function
Someone who enjoys working collaboratively
Someone who has a real passion for Sustainability
Self-Starter
Preferred Qualifications:
If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
Ideally experience with a mix of local market and global brand/category experience – with experience in brand management, communication development, innovation development and deployment
Experience in working with Expert marketing is also welcome – developing ways to engage Expert HCP’s and translating this engagement into recommendations and sales
Experience in customer/sales function or account management with experience of developing, selling in and deploying activities through key global customers
Why GSK?
Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.
These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:
Operating at pace and agile decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.
Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning.
Sustaining energy and well-being.
Building strong relationships and collaboration, honest and open conversations.
Budgeting and cost-consciousness.
At GSK, we're a company with a special purpose, to help people do more feel better and live longer. Realising our purpose starts with us. When we feel at our best, we perform at our best. When you set out on your adventure at GSK, we make a deal. You commit to living GSK's values and expectations and performing against our Innovation, Performance and Trust priorities. And in return, GSK commits to providing the right environment for you to thrive. Put simply, it’s about you being motivated to do your best work, in a place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Together we build an environment where we can all thrive and focus on what matters most to each of us. It is only through the energy, dedication, drive and passion of all of us that we can be the very best for GSK, and importantly, for our patients and consumers.
As a company driven by our values of Patient focus, Transparency, Respect and Integrity, we know inclusion and diversity are essential for us to be able to succeed. We want all our colleagues to thrive at GSK bringing their unique experiences, ensuring they feel good and to keep growing their careers. As a candidate for a role, we want you to feel the same way.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are open to all talent. In the US, we also adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, colour, national origin, religion, gender, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class*(*US only).
We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
Please don’t hesitate to contact us if you’d like to discuss any adjustments to our process which might help you demonstrate your strengths and capabilities. You can either call us on 0808 234 4391, or send an email ukdiversity.recruitment@gsk.com
As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.

We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Internal Sales Associate
at SC Distributors
Costa Mesa, CA - Sales
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $50,000.00 to $80,000.00 /year
The Internal Sales Associate works within the corporate environment and is partnered with a Regional Vice President (RVP) in a geographical sales territory. This individual is responsible for partnering with an RVP, creating new and managing existing relationships with financial advisors to increase market share of Strategic Capital products throughout the given territory. This is accomplished through a consultative sales approach providing financial insight and product information via the telephone, so representatives can effectively offer our platform of alternative investments to their clients. This position requires an individual that has a sales focus with excellent phone skills, strong work ethic and a competitive drive to succeed.
This Position Reports To: National Sales Manager
Essential Job Duties & Responsibilities
Make proactive sales calls on a daily basis with existing representatives to strengthen relationships and find selling opportunities. This includes sales campaigns, new business, follow-up calls, and others as directed.
Schedule quality appointments each week for the RVP.
Proactively research and manage territory goals and initiatives.
Work closely with the RVP to develop and execute an appropriate business plan to maximize territory sales.
Identify and actively convert prospects into producers.
Utilize Strategic Capital's proprietary CRM system to create and maintain up to date information on the territory.
Job Requirements (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities)
Prior investment industry experience
Must have the ability to work in a challenging and collaborative environment
Possess a strong desire to win
Possess excellent oral and written communication skills
Possess excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
Proven ability to pay attention to detail and multi-task
Must have strong relationship building skills
Must be a detail-oriented, well-organized self-starter with high energy and creativity
Securities licensed preferred (Series 7 & 63, etc)
Must have the ability to work in a challenging and collaborative environment
Strategic Capital Management Team Experience
Over 75 years of combined experience in wholesale distribution management. Helped raise over $20 billion in equity capital over the last 15 years.. Successful in distributing Business Development Companies, Non-Traded REITs, Reg D private placement offerings and LLC’s .
About SC Distributors
Strategic Capital’s goal is to be the premier distribution platform for select alternative investment products. Our mission is to connect investors and financial advisors with a focused group of leading alternative investment managers. Through a demonstrated financial services wholesale distribution model, we deliver these products to financial advisors (and their clients) throughout the United States.
Our leadership's extensive experience in wholesale distribution, combined with our strategy to engage a prominent real estate investment banking organization, helped enable us to identify and evaluate the capabilities, backgrounds, financial sustainability and track records of a wide variety of potential investment managers. Finally, our leadership's extensive distribution experience and our proprietary SCORE (Strategic Capital Online Reporting Engine) technology platform helps us to effectively and efficiently track and manage each step of the product delivery process for our financial advisor and broker/dealer partners.

Overview:

At HGA, we are committed to meeting our clients’ sustainability goals as well as challenging our industry. We aim to develop the expertise and research to push beyond net zero energy to net positive energy; from a neutral effect on health, safety, and resources to a positive one. As the need and desire for sustainability environments grow, so does the focus on high-performance buildings with sound data that we can share back with clients and our design teams.
HGA is seeking candidates with experience conducting certification reviews and project documentation in third party rating systems, including MN B3 and LEED for Existing Buildings and New Construction.
HGA is both team-oriented and employee-friendly, and social activities are integrated into our office culture. We offer challenge, recognition and personal visibility with an opportunity to be part of some great projects.
Responsibilities:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participates in project goal-setting and coordination meetings and prepares meeting minutes.
Reviews and revises sustainability policies and programs
Provides comments and technical guidance to the larger team on how to best incorporate certification requirements within the larger framework / goals of the project. Must be comfortable interfacing with all disciplines involved in the design and construction process (including both within and outside of HGA).
Completes certification documentation for third party rating systems.
Works collaboratively with other members of the certifications team.
Performs quality control (QC) review of design documents to verify compliance with third party rating system requirements and project sustainability goals.
Qualifications:

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in one of the following areas: Architecture (architecture, landscape, interior design), Engineering (mechanical, civil, structural), Planning (urban/transportation/environmental planning, urban design), Building Operations (facility management, property management), or demonstrated competency through a combination of another degree not listed and years of experience with sustainability certifications.
LEED AP credentialing required, with specialty expertise BD+C, ID+C, or O+M preferred. Other credentials such as WELL AP and Fitwel will be helpful.
Knowledge and interest in principles of building science.
Demonstrated understanding and experience with reading and reviewing construction drawings, specifications, and construction submittals.
Experience managing MN B3, LEED, WELL, ENERGY STAR, SITES, Fitwel, Living Building Challenge and/or other sustainability systems certification process(es) on commercial projects.
Additional Skills Preferred:
Bluebeam knowledge to create and mark-up drawings efficiently and effectively
Proficiency with Excel spreadsheets
Ability to multitask and manage time efficiently across multiple projects
Meet deadlines and be flexible to changing deadlines
Focused and highly self-motivated
Able to work independently as well as in close collaboration with other staff members and multiple client project teams
Able to teach and mentor team members with different expertise to support knowledge-sharing and elevating the firm’s overall expertise in sustainable design

DEPARTMENT: CITY MANAGER

POSITION TITLE: SUSTAINABILITY COORDINATOR (EXEMPT)

PAY RATE: GRADE 117- $52,986.62 - annually or D.O.Q.

HOURS: MONDAY - FRIDAY, 8:00 A.M. TO 5:00 P.M.


PURPOSE OF POSITION:
The Sustainability Coordinator works collaboratively with administration, city staff, and community partners to develop, coordinate, and promote effective sustainability initiatives to reduce the city’s impact on the environment. Responsibilities include educating the community about sustainability and coordinating programming and activities related to sustainability, performing research about sustainability, and annual reporting.
This position is considered an emergency/disaster position. During emergency conditions, all City employees are automatically considered emergency service workers. City employees are subject to being called to work in the event of a disaster, such as a hurricane, or other emergency situation, which requires that the employee be ready, willing, and able to report to work during emergencies and/or disasters of any kind, notwithstanding any other commitments the employee may have and be able perform emergency services duties, as assigned.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Works with all aspects of the residential and community, including vendors, citizens, businesses, and staff to promote an understanding and awareness of sustainability issues by coordinating informational training and presentations and promoting energy and water conservation, waste minimization, recycling, sustainable building and landscape design, alternative transportation, procurement of green products, etc. as outlined in the City’s Sustainability Action Plan.

Serves as liaison to the Sustainability Advisory Board and between various committees and groups to assure communication and resource coordination for sustainability programs and projects. Leads the City in its efforts to address climate change though adaptation or mitigation efforts, and works in partnership with City departments, community groups, other governmental agencies and others.

Creates promotional and educational materials by writing, editing, and designing content for brochures, fliers, bulletin board displays, newsletters, sustainability guides, and training materials.

Works with the City’s Public Information Officer in developing and maintaining the city’s website that addresses sustainability to include information highlighting sustainability actions undertaken at the City, sustainability-related programming and events at the City and surrounding community, resources for individuals interested in sustainable living, information on recycling, and links to other organizations and websites related to sustainability.

Leads in defining sustainability goals and tracks performance measurement to assess program effectiveness.
Works with existing and prospective businesses to promote sustainable design concepts and practices to further the responsible growth of businesses consistent with the Sustainability Action Plan and the City’s long and short term growth plans. Improves the effectiveness of the City’s sustainability practices by monitoring best practices related to sustainability at the City and other select venue and makes recommendations for new sustainability programming and modifications to existing programs.

Works with the City Manager and other city staff members focusing on sustainability by facilitating and coordinating city sustainability initiatives and related funding.

Works with Facilities Maintenance and other City divisions as appropriate in relation to implementing energy conservation and sustainability programs.

Researches and identifies grant-writing and other funding opportunities in support of expanded city sustainability efforts.

Remains competent and current through self-directed professional reading, developing professional contacts with colleagues, attending professional development courses, and attending training and/or courses as directed.

OTHER JOB FUNCTIONS:
Attends workshops or meetings with staff and the public to ensure communication of the desire of the city to work towards building a sustainable and resilient community.
Perform other duties as assigned.


CRITICAL SKILLS/EXPERTISE:
The ability to work independently, but must also have the ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing with architects, engineers, contractors, developers, owners, supervisors, employees, and the general public; and ability to establish effective working relationships. Attention to detail is required. Initiative is required. The ability to work collaboratively with other individuals and volunteer groups is required. The ability to use Microsoft Office Suite to prepare Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, and reports is required. The ability to develop knowledge of, respect for, and skills to engage with those of other cultures or backgrounds is required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work is performed mostly in an office environment. Some outdoor work is required in the inspection of various land developments and construction sites. Hand-eye coordination is necessary to operate computers and various pieces of office equipment.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is routinely required to stand or sit; walk; talk and hear; use hands to manipulate, handle, feel or operate objects, tools, or controls; and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects of up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.


WORK LOCATION AND ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works in outside weather conditions. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, or airborne particles.
The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet in the office, and moderate to loud in the field.


EQUIPMENT USED:
Computer, including word processing; motor vehicle; calculator; phone; copy; and various graphic design tools.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelors’ degree from an accredited four-year college or university with a degree in public administration, planning, engineering, economics, business administration, or a closely related field. Four (4) to six (6) years’ experience in developing, maintaining, and/or managing sustainability-based initiatives, processes, or programs involving the collection, analysis, and reporting of program data is required. Experience working with sustainability or environmental programs in higher education is preferred, or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Possess and maintain a valid Florida Driver's License. Must also possess the National Incident Management System (NIMS) IS-700 within 30 days of employment and the ICS-100 and ICS-200 within 90 days of employment. There may be additional NIMS required, which will be scheduled by your Supervisor.

Global Packaging Sustainability Technical Director
Location: US or UK
Mars Petcare is hiring a Global Packaging Sustainability Technical Director to lead the R&D portfolio of sustainable packaging for Mars Petcare. This Director willsupport the delivery of breakthrough packaging innovations engaging across functions to ensure successful deployment of these packaging innovations throughout the Mars Petcare. With a strong emphasis on circularity, including collection & recycling systems, the Technical Director is accountable for the technical roadmap and strategic leadership of the sustainable packaging program. The Director will collaborate cross functionally to drive strategy and execution across three Global Innovation Centers (GICs). The scope of this role includes coordination with R&D from other segments and Mars Advanced Research Institute (MARI) to drive synergies and long term science program for novel packaging materials.
What are we looking for?
Master’s Degree
Minimum 10+ years packaging experience, ideally from another FMCG
Leadership including successful deployment of packaging innovations
Background in polymer science, packaging materials, degradable and compostable materials as well as deep technical expertise in , global sustainable packaging strategy and sourcing programs
Strong project, portfolio management, and problem solving skills
Excellent English written and communication skills
Passionate about sustainability and the value it can bring to the planet, our people and to Mars
Knowledge and Experiences in the following:Packaging Subject Matter Expertise: Leads the portfolio of sustainable packaging with in-depth packaging expertise and experience, including:
 packaging technology for sensible food stuff including barrier technologies and sealing, mastering end-of-life technologies and scenarios for
 circular packaging, and LCA competence as it relates to packaging.
Reporting: Utilizes team to develop and share high-quality performance reporting quarterly and annually, enabling robust quantitative and
 qualitative reporting internally and externally
Influencing Internally: Ability to confidently and successfully engage and communicate with senior leaders, explaining the rationale for and
 garnering support for this important work
Team Management: Brilliant people-management skills, able to successfully motivate and drive results with a global team
What would your key responsibilities be:
Owns Technical Platforms: Owns the R&D packaging sustainability technical platforms, including development of alternative material solutions and technologies
Align Technical Workplans: Responsible for creating and aligning the technical work plan, building in the business needs to ensure that the right technical solutions are developed for deployment. Solutions include mono-material flexible films, paper/fibre based materials, bio-based and biodegradable / compostable packaging
Ensures Collaboration: Ensure strong collaboration and a customer-centric approach with regional teams, maximising efficiency and delivering seamless handover of new developments to the regions
Works Cross-Functionally: Responsible for working cross-functionally to ensure that global innovation projects are aligned with our packaging sustainability goals and that the required solutions are being developed to deliver against our Design for Circularity metric
Holds Recycling Expertise: Understands recycling technologies, knows emerging technologies & the actors in the industry. Contributes to the company position on recycling technologies. Reporting: Monitor and communicate the progress of the technical road map / development to ensure the proper execution of the sustainable packaging program and appropriate stakeholders management.
Continuous Improvement: Identify gaps and create plan to address those when required and integrate the appropriate risk identification and management.
Allocation of Resources: Coordinate prioritization, including resource allocation of development program, ensuring consistency within the global and regional teams and within Royal Canin.
Internal Alignment: Drive harmonization and standardization of packaging specifications through the global program in collaboration with procurement and supply
Circularity: Drive consensus on end-of-life management & scenarios across the different functions involved in sustainability to deliver aligned packaging specifications for circularity
R&D: Act as a key contact for Pet Nutrition and drive collaboration for long term science program cross-category with MARI on novel packaging materials. Identify competence needs and gaps for sustainable packaging and address them in the most efficient way
Packaging Related External Collaboration: Build a strong external network to calibrate the program with the expectation of trade associations, recycling associations, regulators and competitors.
What can you expect from Mars?
The opportunity to learn, develop and take charge of your own career.
An industry competitive salary and benefits package.
To be respected and valued.
The Five Principles at the center of every decision
The opportunity to work cross functionally, add value and impact a better world for generations to come.

Department Environment and Conservation

LOCATION OF (1) POSITION TO BE FILLED: DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION, WATER RESOURCES DIVISION, BRADLEY COUNTY
A detailed job description is available at the following website: https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/environment/job-announcements-/preferred-service/00067497_TDEC_ENSC_1_DWR_CHEFO_TDEC-job-opp_ps.pdf
Minimum Qualifications

Education and Experience: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree in environmental science, physical sciences (e.g. physics, chemistry, geology, meteorology), ecology, sustainability or applied science in sustainability, life sciences (e.g. biology, microbiology, health physics or biophysics), environmental health, pre-medicine, engineering or other acceptable science or natural resource related field.
Other Requirements

Necessary Special Qualifications: Applicants for this class must:
Possess a valid motor vehicle operator's license at the time of appointment in some positions;
Applicants for the TDEC Environmental Scientist 1* or Health Physicist 1* in the Division of Radiological Health must successfully complete the training courses offered by the Division of Radiological Health. Failure to do so may result in termination;
TDEC Environmental Scientist's 1* performing geologic duties the major portion of their time must: have completed the required college course work at the time of appointment to be eligible to take the licensing examination offered by Tennessee's Department of Commerce and Insurance's Board of Professional Geologists, or b.) hold and maintain a current Geologic license from the State of Tennessee during employment or hold a current Geologic license from another State that Tennessee has evaluated and granted reciprocal licensing rights;
Some TDEC Environmental Scientist 1* positions assigned to function as Biologists must meet the specific educational requirements for Biologists, as follows: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree, including at least 36 quarter hours (or 24 semester hours) in biology, in one of the following areas: (1) biology or biological sciences, (2) botanical sciences, (3) environmental or conservation sciences, (4) zoological sciences, or (5) aquatic, terrestrial, or wetland biology or ecology or other acceptable biological science related field.
Examination Method: Education and Experience, 100%, for Preferred Service positions.

Job Overview

Summary: Under immediate supervision, is responsible for learning professional environmental, natural resources, sustainability, environmental assistance program, radiological health and/or similar science related program work of routine difficulty; and learns to perform related work as required.

Distinguishing Features: *This is the entry level class in the TDEC Environmental Scientist subseries. An employee in this class may be assigned to learn a variety of environmental compliance inspection, monitoring, problem identification, corrective action and enforcement duties in an environmental regulatory or assistance division. An employee in this class may be assigned to learn natural resource management and/or inventory in conservation or other, non-regulatory programs. This class differs from TDEC Environmental Scientist 3 in that an incumbent of the latter performs environmental program duties at the advanced working or lead level under general supervision.
*An applicant appointed to this flexibly staffed class will be reclassified to TDEC Environmental Scientist 2* after successful completion of a mandatory one year probationary period; inadequate or marginal performance during the probationary period will result in automatic termination.

Work Activities

Resolving Conflicts and Negotiating with Others:
Investigates complaints; develops corrective recommendations for identified problems, and if necessary, initiates legal action to effect compliance of established standards, laws, rules, regulations, or policies.
Drafting, Laying Out, and Specifying Technical Devices, Parts, and Equipment:
Prepares documentation (such as permits, designs, layout, blueprints, soil evaluations, etc.), in a concise and defensible manner, to ensure Agency's missions are met.
Inspecting Equipment, Structures, or Material:
Conduct inspections of equipment, structures and/or material, to ensure proper installation, maintenance, and/or operation.
Making Decisions and Solving Problems:
Learn to determine the validity and severity of an incident and appropriate response.
Analyzes available information and makes recommendations to ensure the best solution is chosen to meet regulatory, project, and/or stakeholders' needs.
Determines validity and severity of violation(s) and if an enforcement action is warranted.
Review plans and reports to determine future regulatory actions.
Interpreting the Meaning of Information for Others:
Interprets findings, results, (i.e. site inspections, permits, lab results, etc.) and communicates interpretation of regulations, policy, guidance to stakeholders.
Prepare various publications, reports, technical documents, maps and plans.
Interacting With Computers:
Possesses general knowledge and utilizes computer software including but not limited to: statistical programs, scientific instruments, modeling, Geographic Information System (GIS), databases, word processing, spreadsheets, email, etc.
Generate reports and documents utilizing contemporary computer software.
Processing Information:
Compile legally defensible environmental documents.
Compiles, processes, and reviews records, data, operational plans, enforcement action requests, reports, etc.
Reviews Quality Assurance/Quality Control parameters, specific to and required by acceptable methodologies are performed with each data set.
Prepare statistical/metric reports for aquatic, terrestrial, and wetland evaluations.
Analyzing Data or Information:
Analyze environmental and/or other information, such as monitoring records, site inspections, sampling data to determine if further action is necessary and to evaluate trends.
Prepare plans, maps or reports of findings relating to health and environmental data.
Analyze environmental data using mathematical and statistical methods.
Assist in developing standards.
Performs laboratory or field tests based specific sample requirements.
Review plans to ensure protection of human health and the environment.
Interpret analytical results to determine data quality and usability.
Assist in conducting studies of environmental pollution or ionizing radiation and any socioeconomic effects.
Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance with Standards:
Perform inspections and/or investigations when required by a specific TDEC program area such as air pollution, water resources, remediation, underground storage tanks, solid waste management, radiological health, natural areas, etc. to determine compliance with laws, regulations, or standards.
Enforce environmental or other standards, laws, rules, regulations, and/or administrative policies and procedures, taking corrective action as warranted.
Determines if documents (i.e., permits, applications, National Environmental Policy Act, licenses, accreditations and certifications, etc.) may be approved by reviewing and evaluating information submitted by applicant or acquired by site inspections and/or other informative sources used for determining minimum environmental or other compliance with established standards.
Adheres to requirements specified in Standard Operating Procedures and any applicable federal and/or state standards.
Ensures statutory obligations are fulfilled.
Oversee environmental sampling and/or investigations to assure that acceptable procedures are followed.
Compares environmental and/or health related data to applicable criteria.
Reviews and evaluates applications, forms, plans, inspection documents, general correspondence, reports or other records to ensure technical adequacy.
Audits third party inspections of facilities to determine compliance with regulatory standards.
Assesses fees based on the regulatory standards.
Performing General Physical Activities:
Collect environmental samples and/or monitoring data (e.g., soil, rock, air, water, sediment, sludge, biological), under physically demanding conditions.
Perform physical activities, such as walking (i.e. ditches, uneven terrain, etc.), wading in water, climbing, lifting (such as coolers, generators, etc.), operating field equipment (backpack shockers, augers, core samplers, or probes), etc.
Operates, carries or handles equipment/machinery unassisted that may weigh up to 50 pounds.
Performs physically demanding, ecologically-based stewardship and natural resource management on state natural areas, (utilizing equipment, such as backpack sprayer, chainsaw, bush hog, lawnmower, tractor, etc. in the management of rare species habitat, controlled fire, trail maintenance, boundary maintenance, invasive species control, etc.)
Documenting/Recording Information:
Prepares and maintains complete and accurate records, reports, logs, databases, chain-of-custody and correspondence based on established guidelines and procedures.
Maintains records of observations made during field evaluations to document data collection, ambient site conditions, and the location of the evaluation.
Documents all relevant work activities, contacts, and meetings.
Monitor Processes, Materials, or Surroundings:
Performs environmental or health investigations, remediation, and/or monitoring work, including sampling and evaluation of pollutants to determine compliance with environmental or other standards.
Serves as a technical advisor to emergency responders for incidents/accidents.
Reviews monitoring data to determine permit compliance, environmental standards and/or ecological conditions.
Comply with safe handling, storage and disposal procedures for samples, laboratory reagents and other chemicals.
Verify expiration dates of chemicals and supplies, disposing of expired materials as required by safety rules and regulations.
Repairing and Maintaining Electronic Equipment:
Maintains, repairs and calibrates electronic equipment, such as radiation detection meter, photo ionization detector, pH meter, GPS, and X-ray fluorescence (XRF) as needed.
Provide Consultation and Advice to Others:
Provide technical expertise in handling events involving radiation and radioactive material, including transportation, and industrial incidents as well as natural catastrophes.
Provide consultative, technical, or educational services to industry, municipalities, counties, individuals, or groups in the necessity and methodology of enhancing environmental stewardship, health or other standards, practices, and safety.
Update regulatory information to stakeholders.

job_title: Refugee Youth Mentoring Program Coordinator - Chattanooga
job_descriptions:
Refugee Youth Mentoring Program Coordinator - Chattanooga



The Tennessee Office for Refugees (TOR) is a department of Catholic Charities of Tennessee responsible for the coordination and administration of the statewide refugee program. We partner with organizations that provide direct services to refugees and other eligible populations in and near Chattanooga, Knoxville, Memphis, and Nashville. This position is housed at Bridge Refugee Services in Chattanooga. This is a great opportunity for a VISTA member who wants to develop leadership, program development and management, and community relations skills while making a real impact in the lives of refuge youth and young adults. Working with Bridge will offer the VISTA member the opportunity to work deeply and specifically on this project, as well as to gain knowledge of and contribute to a continuum of resettlement services in Chattanooga. The VISTA member will be part of a six VISTA member cohort that will meet regularly for training and coordination. The VISTA member will travel to the National Mentoring Summit in January in Washington, DC. Professional development opportunities will be provided on an ongoing basis. We are looking for a self-starter who works well both independently and as part of a team. Eagerness to learn about refugees, mentoring, and all aspects of nonprofit program management and development are a must. Foreign language proficiency in a refugee language and significant intercultural experience is a plus. We are looking for a VISTA member with the ability to facilitate intercultural communication and to create an environment where differences are respected; to exercise good judgment, courtesy, and tact in dealing with the public and staff; to handle confidential information with extreme professionalism; attention to detail and adherence to deadlines; to plan and organize work; to follow tasks through to completion; effective interpersonal skills; strong written and verbal communication skills; and basic computer proficiency.








Member Duties : The VISTA member will help lead the development and implementation of a new mentoring program for refugee youth and young adults ages 15 – 24 to increase their educational and economic opportunities. The VISTA member will increase the capacity of the local refugee services network by strengthening and expanding partnerships; exercise skills in developing program and training materials, and public speaking and in providing orientations for program participants and training for volunteer mentors; expand the scope of supportive services for refugees in Chattanooga by recruiting, assessing, and matching participants with volunteer mentors; develop data collection and analysis skills by utilizing a program database and using findings to inform program improvements; evaluate program sustainability and pursue additional resources as needed including grant writing; and coordinate with other site-based VISTA members and VISTA Leader.


Program Benefits : Childcare assistance if eligible , Health Coverage* , Living Allowance , Relocation Allowance , Training , Choice of Education Award or End of Service Stipend .



For details about AmeriCorps VISTA healthcare benefits, please visit http://www.vistacampus.gov/healthcare


Terms :

Permits working at another job during off hours , Car recommended , Permits attendance at school during off hours .


Service Areas :

Education , Community and Economic Development .


Skills :

Fund raising/Grant Writing , Public Speaking , Youth Development , Leadership , Teaching/Tutoring , Education , Writing/Editing , Communications , Social Services , Recruitment , Community Organization .



SUMMARY

AmeriCorps VISTA


Program

615-354-6287

Listing ID 92235

FIGS is hiring a Fabric R&D Manager to support the development of fabric in alignment with sourcing, cost and lead time strategy. This role requires strong strategic, technical and inspirational leadership qualities with a proven track record of driving material development strategies balancing aesthetic, quality, function, cost and responsive needs.


Responsibilities

Work with the design team and Fabric RD Director on the new novelty and core updates for key meetings and seasonal presentations
Source, research and develop fabrics originating from global markets and communicate findings to the brand including; actual samples, costing, lead-times and all required FDS information
Work directly and closely with the mills to ensure developments are implemented within the guidelines of design integrity, as well as product and sourcing strategy
Excellent communication skills with an ability to partner effectively with designers, mills, vendors and production partners
Collaborate between internal teams, mills, and suppliers to meet calendar deadlines and price targets surrounding fabric sourcing and development
Review incoming developments and make comments based on design feedback
Develop and maintain relationships with mills and suppliers to ensure successful business partnership
Support the cross functional teams at the fabric level of new projects (CSI, 3D modelling etc.)
Organize and maintain fabric development (WIP) and benchmarking tools
Ensure all fabrications meet FIGS performance attributes, testing requirements and sustainability requirements to support marketing claims (wicking, odor management, UPF, etc)
Ensure on time delivery of materials to various production facilities by maintaining fabric WIP reports
Build and maintain a fabric library of core/new fabrics in the office


Qualifications

4-6 years of experience in fabric R&D
1-2 years of management experience
Good technical knowledge of fabric, yarn, dyeing, functional finishing processes and its testing standards
Proficient in GSuite, Google Slides and Google Sheets/Excel preferred
Ability to build strong relationships & maintain alignment with internal & external, cross functional partners
Agile and Flexible- our pace and process is fast and every changing, must be able to manage multiple projects and problems under time pressure
Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Preferred qualifications

Previous experience on activewear/functional fabrics
Degree in Fashion, Textile, Product Development or similar field
Sustainability experience
Experience with CLO

A little bit about us…

The medical apparel industry is antiquated, highly fragmented and, until FIGS, was driven solely by low-cost providers offering a limited selection of poor quality products sold through third party distributors. FIGS is revolutionizing the medical apparel industry by creating the highest quality medical apparel in the world and by selling directly to medical professionals through our branded ecommerce site.

FIGS' foundation is built on product quality, and we have a relentless focus on three key areas: fabric, fit and function. We developed our proprietary, performance-oriented fabric technology to meet the demands of the medical profession. FIGS' Technical Collection fabric is wrinkle resistant, moisture-wicking, lightweight, breathable and offers four-way stretch. Our designs are tailored, sophisticated and innovative, incorporating features such as yoga waistbands, smart storage (pockets, zippers, hidden pockets) and inspirational sayings inside each garment that appeal to modern healthcare professionals.

By offering a branded and customer-centric online shopping experience, we are changing how medical professionals buy their workwear. Through our website, social media, and participation in medical conferences and events, we have built a strong following within the medical community and a meaningful connection with our customers, which allows us to understand their needs and to ensure that FIGS is continuously improving and innovating.

FIGS' Threads for Threads initiative is central to our mission. FIGS has donated hundreds of thousands of scrubs to healthcare providers in need around the world.

We are:
Open Innovation segment leads and consultants are responsible for working on the development of emerging partnership strategies and client pipelines, by identifying key business problems, analyzing client issues within it and providing recommendations to leaders on partnership development – enabling them to make the right strategic choices on a select set of innovative partners to recurringly test, deploy and service at clients.
You are:
Segment leads support the Accenture business they work with in developing differentiated analysis of the ecosystem, assessing market categories and startups, whilst providing ideas and a framework for recommendations – and ultimately Go-To-Market success. This entails working at all levels, internally and externally, with a range of different organizations and regions.
Drive client impact and partner-related revenue growth: collaborate with Ventures’ geographic leads to create and maintain a global client sales pipeline, originate and support client opportunities by developing the services business for early and follow-on client deployments
Build a strong internal network to generate opportunities for our partner companies: Leverage close relationships with relevant executive stakeholders and collaborators to identify opportunities to spread awareness of our partner companies, with the intention to embed these players in client opportunities, account plans, or market development and asset development activities
Originate, develop, and execute new partnerships: Collaborate with sustainabilitystartups and lead discussions with internal leadership teams to develop joint business models and client value propositions; own complex workstreams that involve collaborating with stakeholders with a range of different incentives and desired outcomes.
Act as a strategic advisor: Act as a point of contact for our partner companies, providing initial assessments on a startups’ fit to a client need
Be an expert in Sustainability: Stay up to date on emerging trends, technologies, disruptors, and business models impacting Accenture’s clients; leverage knowledge to inform Accenture’s partnership strategy and client recommendations in the space

Here's what you need:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience)

Bonus Points, if:
Demonstrated building complex partnerships with multiple partners that resulted in high revenue growth
Experience with developing account strategy and executing on sales plans, which involve bringing a deal from cold lead to close
Familiarity with the sustainability landscape, which includes startups to larger tech players with a sustainability offerings
Firm understanding with how consulting firms operate and its respective business models
Ability to effectively switch between strategy and tactics, coupled with a strong sense of urgency to move sales opportunities forward
Skilled in synthesizing information from various sources and infer practical implications to Accenture’s or our clients’ business
Ability to thrive in a high-pressure sales environment
Excellent program and project management skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills to present information effectively to novice and expert audiences
Experience valued: startup founder/CxO, corporate strategy and/or consulting, corporate innovation, pre-sales or strategic partnerships, VC and PE,
MBA preferred

AECOM is seeking an Environmental Scientist Intern to be based in Chelmsford, MA or Providence, RI.

This position is expected to begin in May/June 2021.

About AECOM

At AECOM, we believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

We take on the most complex challenges and pioneer innovative, iconic solutions that push the limits of what’s possible – the world’s longest cable-stayed bridge, record-breaking sports events, the largest greenfield port development mega project, life-sustaining disaster recovery programs, and the tallest tower in the Western Hemisphere.

On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, energy and the environment, we deliver professional services throughout the project lifecycle.

We are proud to be recognized for excellence:
+ Named one of _Fortune_ magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies" for the sixth consecutive year

+ Ranked #1 in _Engineering News-Record_ ’s 2020 “Top 200 Environmental Firms”

+ Ranked #1 in Transportation and General Building in _Engineering News-Record_ ’s 2020 “Top 500 Design Firms”

+ VIQTORY 2020 Military Friendly® Gold Employer

About DCS—Environment

AECOM is the leading, worldwide environmental services provider to industry and government — delivering sustainable energy and environmental solutions to meet compliance, business and operational needs. Our advisory and technical staff deliver specialized solutions to unusual and complex problems facing client projects across the full business life cycle — from asset planning, development and operations, to product integration and facility compliance, to site remediation, restoration, sustainability and reuse, and holistic strategies that improve and modernize next generation energy infrastructure. Our solutions balance complex technical, regulatory, business and stakeholder issues to produce measurable value and cost-saving approaches for our clients

Our services are delivered by 7,400 responsive environmental professionals around the world. Our global staff has in-depth knowledge of local and regional requirements and broad technical expertise in 60 disciplines. We work together across our global network to bring the best resources, skills and efficiencies to our projects.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

+ Support various projects for data gathering, evaluation and reporting.

+ Field task support.

+ Internships are designed to introduce and build essential, hands on skills that differ from those attained in the academic arena and help to enhance the transition from student to professional.

+ Interns are assigned duties that will provide a broad, well-rounded learning experience within their field of study.

Minimum Requirements

+ Currently in pursuit of a Bachelor's Degree in Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, Geology or related field and must have completed two years of qualified study

+ Due to the nature of the work, U.S. citizenship is required

+ Valid U.S. driver's license

Preferred Qualifications

+ Strong interest in environmental field work

+ Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Additional Information:
+ Candidates local to the Chelmsford, MA or Providence, RI area preferred

What We Offer

When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future. Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world, but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

The Program Associate of Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Verification Program, is a key member of the team who carries out a variety of auditing, client support, and operations tasks related to carbon offset verification, primarily for the non-forestry portion of the GHG Verification Program. Carbon offset project types include agriculture, landfill, ozone depleting substances (ODS), livestock, electric vehicles, industrial processes, campus sustainability, and others.
The SCS GHG Verification Program is a leader in the field of carbon offset verification, having verified close to 300 million tonnes of CO2-e since 2008. It is the recipient of the Best Verification Company reward as recently as 2018.
Areas of responsibility include auditing and verification, coordination and operations, program quality, and assistance in business development. At the direction of the GHG Program Manager, and in conjunction with the GHG Program Director, the GHG Program Associate will work to support forestry and non-forestry related activities of the Greenhouse Gas Verification Program and assist with other responsibilities, as needed. For the right candidate and commensurate with background and goals, the opportunity to explore growth opportunities and advancement into other roles will be provided.
Relevant Services/Schemes
Services:
GHG Verification- carbon offset projects (landfill, ozone depleting substances (ODS), agriculture, livestock, electric vehicle, campus sustainability, manufacturing, industrial processes, and others)
GHG Consulting related to non-forestry carbon offset project types
Additional non-forestry categories, as assigned
Schemes:
California Air Resources Board Cap-and-Trade Program
Climate Action Reserve
Verra/Verified Carbon Standard
American Carbon Registry
SD VISta
Additional schemes, as assigned

Prepare and submit verification/audit reports within established timelines

Participate in development and implementation of consulting projects relevant to this position
Client Support
Engage with clients, client prospects, and networks
Assist with outreach and marketing to new clients and for development of new business areas
Supporting clients to scope projects, gather data, etc.
Assist with preparation of proposals and project budgets
Respond to client questions and concerns and document communications
Ensure clients are informed about the verification and process and relevant requirements
Address client concerns in a timely fashion while keeping the manager abreast of any issues
Manage Verification Process
Track and report on verification status, ensure benchmarks are meeting established deadlines
Communicate with technical staff to ensure timely service delivery
Prepare and maintain verification related documentation
Track and allocate audit budget and expenses
Program Quality
Ensure program compliance with program quality system and relevant GHG schemes
Ensure consistent interpretation and application of standards
Support staff during the internal audit process
Assist in the investigation of complaints involving accreditation body
Adhere to and enforce all quality and code of conduct standards
Administrative Support
Generate invoices and track payments
Maintain electronic and paper files
Ensure audit documentation (e.g., work orders, contracts, and reports) is properly executed and maintained

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree in relevant scientific field such as engineering, environmental science, chemistry
2 years professional experience requiring quantitative work and technical report writing, or 1 year of professional experience plus a graduate degree (e.g., Masters or PhD degree in scientific field such as engineering, environmental science, chemistry
Ability to work independently or in team-oriented situation in our Emeryville headquarters office or from remote office location
Very strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize numerous tasks effectively to meet deadlines
Ability to learn quickly or adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Professional demeanor in all forms of communication.
Accuracy, attention to detail, and ability to proof your own work.

The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them.
Job Summary
In Corporate Relations, we:
Build enduring relationships between Allstate and its stakeholders by telling Allstate’s iconic story and bringing the voice of Allstate to life through internal and external strategic communications.
Know the business and work closely with business leaders as thought partners, continuing to strengthen Allstate’s reputation, strategy and culture.
Provide world-class communications counsel to advance issues and initiatives important to our stakeholders.
As an integral leader on the Corporate Relations team, the Manager, Sustainability Communications will:
Implement the company’s sustainability strategy, to include managing and reporting on the company’s approach to environmental, social and governance (ESG) priorities.
Help position Allstate as a leader on corporate sustainability by preparing comprehensive responses to external ESG surveys, including but not limited to CDP and DJSI.
Strengthen Allstate’s sustainability presence and leadership through identified critical forums.
Work with the Allstate Sustainability Council and other business partners to facilitate alignment on key strategic and material sustainability topics.
Support Allstate’s integrated reporting of sustainability and financial disclosures.
Key Responsibilities
Manage ESG reporting and disclosures:
Strong experience with sustainability / ESG reporting.
Experience with GRI, IRRC, TCFD, SASB and other identified global reporting frameworks.
Lead Allstate’s responses to external ESG questionnaires and surveys:
Maintain and support partnerships with Subject Matter Experts across the enterprise to help ensure accurate and transparent reporting and public disclosures.
Knowledge of survey methodology and guidance/criteria for insurance and financial sectors preferred, including but not limited to the CDP and DJSI surveys.
Support sustainability partnerships and initiatives:
Partner with internal business units, including Sourcing and Procurement, Investments, Real Estate and Administration, Enterprise Risk and Return, Human Resources and others to implement ESG priorities, including but not limited to supporting the adoption and execution of a science-based target or low carbon plan.
Strengthen storytelling around Allstate’s ESG priorities to all stakeholders, including employees, the agency force, consumers, customers, investors, policy makers and opinion leaders, including by proactively managing and updating the Allstate integrated report website
Provide ongoing support to the Allstate Sustainability Council, ensuring strong progress on Allstate's strategic ESG priorities and multi-year Sustainability Roadmap
Demonstrate the effectiveness of Allstate’s sustainability and ESG communications at sustaining and lifting Allstate’s reputation, confidence in Allstate’s business strategy and enhancing a purpose-driven culture
Make data-driven decisions: Use stakeholder data and analytics to monitor and measure the effectiveness of internal/external communication plans and stakeholder engagement plans in the short term and recommend enhancements.
Champion Allstate’s purpose-driven culture: Support the implementation of communication plans and tactics to help create an inclusive, empowering, and purpose-driven corporate culture aligned to and supportive of Allstate’s corporate strategy and narrative. Model effective change behaviors to encourage others through times of change.
Partner with PR/Media Relations and Social Centers of Excellence (COE): Work with the PR and Social COEs to ensure strong storytelling about Allstate’s progress on key ESG priorities to consumers and other external stakeholders.
Develop talent: Serve as a peer leader across the team and department and actively recruit talent. Effectively recruit, onboard and support ongoing development of any direct reports.
Effectively manage resources: Support development of project and program budgets and manage forecasts monthly in support of Corporate Relations goals. As needed, manage external/vendor relationships according to department expectations and corporate policies.
Proactively manage issues: Take a 360-degree perspective to uncover issues that may negatively impact Allstate’s reputation, working with the Issues Team on resolution and mitigation.

Job Qualifications
Education and Experience:
5-7+ years of experience in sustainability profession/consulting, corporate communications, public relations, or public policy preferred; insurance or financial services business acumen a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in a business, communications or sustainability related field.
Location:
Candidates may reside in the Chicagoland area or work from a remote location.
Skills:
Sustainability Expertise: Employs working knowledge of sustainability frameworks, disclosures and best practices among large public companies. Executes specific aspects of corporate responsibility and sustainability programs. Ability to look at issues from multiple perspectives with a sense of fairness and balance, seeing both business and social realities. Draws on optimism and conviction to help build and support a specific sustainability involvement program designed to make a difference and inspire and engage others.
Communication Strategy and Planning: Helps plan and execute specific sustainability projects and related communications. Consistently leverages organizational awareness and interpersonal communication skills to influence others to engage with and offer support to specific corporate responsibility initiatives.
Executive Communication: Assists in planning and executing communications that engage C-suite executives and corporate directors as champions of corporate responsibility programs.
Financial and Insurance Acumen: Knowledge of financial and insurance industry. Contributes ideas for how to align corporate responsibility goals and activities to capitalize on industry trends and / or address key industry concerns.

Presentation and Verbal Communications: Ability to prepare complex presentations incorporating key messages aligned with strategic goals of business. Consistently demonstrates effective written and verbal skills and is an effective presenter.

Social Media: Consistently uses social media strategically to holistically integrate off-line and online interactive tactics for specific corporate responsibility programs.
Reputation Leadership and Brand Management: Understands the importance of maintaining a strong reputation and brand.
Strategic Thinking: Generates innovative ideas to address emerging or potential corporate responsibility and sustainability issues in a way that advances company priorities. Consistently presents solutions clearly, enhances existing ideas to maximize opportunities, supports a creative, innovative environment and connects the dots to find the ideal intersection between community needs and business resources.

Overview:

Berry Global, headquartered in Evansville, Indiana, is committed to its mission of ‘Always Advancing to Protect What’s Important.’ With $13 billion in revenue for fiscal year 2019 on a combined pro forma basis from operations, Berry is a leading global supplier of a broad range of innovative nonwoven, flexible, and rigid products used every day within consumer and industrial end markets. Berry operates over 290 manufacturing facilities worldwide, on six continents, and employs over 48,000 individuals.
At Berry, we pursue excellence in all that we do and are always advancing to improve the way we work along with the products and services we provide. Our culture fosters trust and partnerships through appreciation, acknowledgement, and inclusion. At Berry, we are continuously improving to support our mission and exemplify our values of partnerships, excellence, growth, and safety. To learn more about Berry, visit berryglobal.com.
The Sustainability Director - US will be responsible for the overall coordination, implementation, and oversight of our long term sustainability strategy, Impact 2025. Responsible for coordination of sustainability metrics, audits, and sustainability initiatives to support the effort. Serve as a key member of the Corporate Sustainability Team and as a member of the HHS Divisional lead team. Champion both internal and external sustainability requests, such as internal reporting and requests from customers or suppliers. Continually demonstrate sustainable practices and lead by example. The position has responsibility for the global sustainability program within the HHS Division, based out of Evansville, IN.
Responsibilities:
Work across the HHS Division to drive implementation of our Impact 2025 sustainability strategy.
Drive awareness and accountability around sustainability through all levels of the division.
Serve as a key team member of the Corporate Sustainability Team and represent the HHS Division.
Champion employee empowerment to identify and address sustainability improvements, and generate new ideas related to sustainability.
Lead HHS Division to develop and execute sustainability and environmental projects like Zero Waste to Landfill, Carbon/Waste/Utility Reduction and ensure a positive social and environmental impact.
Promote and participate in employee involvement in sustainability programs.
Develop, create, and deliver sustainability training to employees as required.
Coordinate reporting and audit metrics for our sustainability initiatives, including product recyclability, recycled content, energy and water consumption, and waste generation.
Provide regular Sustainability reports to management; identify trends by analyzing data and recommend corrective actions or global initiatives.
Collaborate with Corporate Sustainability Team and Marketing/Communications to share progress both internally and externally through a variety of different formats, including aiding in annual reports, social media, and webinars.
Take ownership of the HHS Division greenhouse gas inventory.
Coordinate and Respond to various 3rd party information requests, such as customer or supplier requests.
Stay abreast of industry trends, regulation, and new technologies/materials.
Maintain and increase professional knowledge through annual professional development.
Participate on Management of Change (MOC)/Pre-startup Safety Review (PSSR) on new or modified equipment around sustainability measures.
Participate in reviewing chemical approval process.
Perform other duties as directed by the EVP of Operations or VP Innovation.
Ability to travel 0-25% of the time.
The above duties are representative of the nature and level of the work and are not necessarily all-inclusive.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time; dust; heat; humidity, odors. The noise level in the work environment varies and hearing protection is required in some work areas.

Knowledge of sustainability calculations, methodology and data analysis.
Experience to include leading and influencing industrial sites and organizations around Sustainability.
Strong leadership, communication, influencing and collaborative skills.
Strong organizational skills with proven ability to complete multiple tasks simultaneously.
Takes responsibility for actions, respects confidentiality, completes commitments on time, and uses data to support decisions.
Self-motivated to improve processes and performance. Can adapt and reapply new ideas and methods to improve team/plant performance.
