 The State Education Resource Center (SERC) is recruiting candidates for a full-time position as an Education Consultant: Programming under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) with specific knowledge, experience, and expertise in school/district leadership, special education instruction, and procedures and practices. This position reports directly to the Director for Special Education Programs and Instructional Design.

SERC’s mission is to provide resources, professional development, and a centralized library to educators, families, and community members in collaboration with the CT State Board of Education and other partners. SERC believes that all students have the right to access opportunities and experiences that reflect and respect their differences and abilities. Research indicates that educational outcomes for students of color, students who are English learners, and students with disabilities continue to lag behind outcomes of other students. SERC’s consultants and staff, in collaboration with our partners in school districts and organizations, build the capacity of educators, service providers, and families to meet the diverse needs of our student population.

General Summary
The Education Consultant is an instructional leader who designs, delivers, and evaluates high- quality professional development that supports the application of learning, systems change, and capacity-building for educators and school leaders. Through collaborative internal and external partnerships, consultants operationalize SERC’s vision of Equity-Excellence-Education by applying a lens of equity and 21st-century skills to all programming, technical assistance, and materials development.

Essential Job Functions
Applicants must have demonstrated ability in the following: the ability to complete the following:
Specific expertise, education, and experience in data-driven decision-making and data teams, curriculum and instruction, and special education, including strong knowledge of effective high leverage, evidence-based strategies that meet the needs of all special education students.
Demonstrated teaching ability in heterogeneous and inclusive settings, including the necessary knowledge of IEP development, specially designed instruction, accommodations and modifications, assistive technology, accessible educational materials, and instructional/behavioral strategies to support all learners.
Designing, implementing and facilitating leadership trainings on topics such as Planning and Placement team leadership and facilitation skills as well as professional learning sessions for general education/special education administrators on building their leadership knowledge in special education procedures and practices.
Planning and coordinating professional learning programs that are accessible, inclusive, and culturally relevant to the needs of participants. A working knowledge of standards for professional learning is vital.
Expertise in transition planning services and supports for students with disabilities, specifically high school through postsecondary school.
Experience in data team implementation and facilitation, multi-tiered systems of support, and effective strategies that meet the needs of culturally and linguistically diverse learners in general education settings.
Project development and management skills; strong interpersonal skills to work with a variety of external stakeholders to support the work of the agency; strong attention to detail; ability to work effectively and efficiently with an internal team of consultants.
Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Responsibilities
SERC’s IDEA Education Consultant will handle a wide array of responsibilities in partnership with peers, schools, school districts, agencies, and community organizations. They include, but are not limited to:
Build collaborative relationships with internal and external partners such as state agencies, school districts, colleges, universities, and community organizations.
Assist in the programming for students with disabilities, including logistical planning, scheduling, management, and oversight of professional learning opportunities, services, and programs.
Coordinate and provide peer coaching, mentoring, modeling, and other types of educational and instructional support geared to enhance academic success for disabled learners.
Assist school administrators with district-level and school-level strategic programming that supports the academic achievement of students with disabilities.
Maintain an understanding of current state and national matters related to the needs of disabled learners.
Plan and implement a comprehensive program evaluation designed to develop, monitor, and adjust programming for professional learning.
Identify the intersection of equity (race, language, culture, and ethnicity) within all aspects of education and schooling as a link to promote seamless connections and ensure coherence with the agency’s vision of Equity. Excellence. Education.
Demonstrate work in culturally diverse and inclusive settings.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Knowledge of:
General needs of disabled learners regarding access to academic education and content.
Systems change, implementation fidelity, and professional development to build capacity and ensure sustainability and coaching.
Professional learning standards, adult learning, and differentiated learning models to design the effective delivery of professional learning and achieve intended outcomes.
Federal and state laws, regulations, statutes, and policies specific to learners with disabilities.
Skill in:
Utilizing research-based strategies specific to the needs of learners with disabilitites.
Using quantitative and qualitative student, educator and system data to plan, inform and guide program development, all of which would be used to monitor and adjust programming.
Providing high-quality customer service and collaborative communication that is culturally responsive and accessible for multiple stakeholders internal and external to the implementation of professional learning.
Facilitating the development and execution of state-level policy, research-based practices, and strategies for implementing sustainable change in the area of culturally and linguistically diverse learners.
Communicating professionally and effectively, as well as keen attention-to-detail.
Ability to:
Communicate and market the professional learning opportunities, services, products, resources, or programs.
Develop funding sources and collaborate with funders in the development and implementation of effective professional learning that meets agreed-upon outcomes.
Identify the intersection of equity (race, language, culture, and ethnicity) within all aspects of education and schooling as a link to promote seamless connections and ensure coherence with the agency’s vision of Equity. Excellence. Education.
Demonstrate work in culturally diverse and inclusive settings.

The ideal applicants must have demonstrated effectiveness in a collaborative, highly team-oriented environment, yet possess initiative, self-motivation, and the ability to manage multiple priorities independently, and work with minimal supervision. Candidates from racially, culturally, and linguistically diverse backgrounds and candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Supervisory Responsibility
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

Work Environment
The IDEA Education Consultant operates in a professional office environment. Appropriate business attire is required. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones. There are off-site requirements, specific to workshops, training, or school and community work.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the functions of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; be mobile; use hands or fingers; handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms and lift/carry items. The capacity to drive and the availability of a car is preferred.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time, exempt position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Occasionally, weekend or after-hours work might be necessary.

Education and Experience
Master’s degree in Special Education or a related field is required and a Sixth-Year Certificate or Doctorate is preferred, AND experience working in public schools or programs.

Salary Range
*$87,500 to $115,700
New hires will start at the first step of the salary range.

Apply online at: www.ctserc.org (select Employment under the About tab). SERC reserves the right to substitute years of experience for certification or degrees. SERC may expand inquiries into materials submitted in support of an applicant’s candidacy without further permission from the applicant.

SERC is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages the application of individuals from racially, culturally, and linguistically diverse backgrounds and from persons with disabilities.

We are hiring for a Intern 2021 Customer Experience Insights Intern at our downtown campus.

About Us:
Our story begins in 1984, with a group of friends who wanted to improve lives. Nu Skin founders Sandie Tillotson, Blake Roney, and Steve Lund committed to create beauty and skincare products with an "all of the good and none of the bad" mentality. Fast forward 36 years later, Nu Skin is operating and improving people's lives in nearly 50 markets across the world. Our founder’s dedication to premium beauty products and supporting independent business owners has kept us growing into the global, publicly traded company we are today. We promote a culture of being a "force for good" in the world while also providing personal and professional growth.

About the Role:
This role will be a part of the Project Management Team within the Customer Experience (CX) Insights department. This role will co-ordinate and collaborate the efforts of the quantitative research team, qualitative research team, and analytics team. The collective Insights teams’ focus is to hear the voice of the customer and understand customer needs and opportunities. The teams do this by collecting and analyzing behavioral and attitudinal data about our customers. The Insights teams create actionable insights from these analyses that informs our customer journeys and allows stakeholders to take action to refine and improve on our customer experience. The Project Management team is responsible for effective communication and ensuring timely delivery of the Insights teams’ projects. This specific role is designed to support the operations and process of the Insights teams.

We work on a global level across multiple cultures and customer experience channels. This position provides experience working on many aspects of the customer journey.
What you'll do:
Assist the Project Manager with operational tasks
Coordinate language translationsImprove and maintain WorkflowsTeam communicationsSet up and manage trainings
Assist each of the three insights teams:
Quantitative Research Team

 - Assist in launching customer experience surveys globally (survey creation, design, fielding, cleaning, tagging, analyzing, etc.)

 - Dashboard design; develop and maintain

Qualitative Research Team
 - Assist with coordinating focus groups, in-depth interviews, taste tests, home-usage tests, etc. (facility reservations, recruiting scheduling, market communication, study observation, recording transcripts, stimulus materials, etc.)

 Analytics Team
 - Dashboard design and creation
Support and Assist other leaders in the broader Customer Experience organization as needed.
Assist in setup and implementation of Adobe Workfront

 - Workflow, reporting, calendaring, reviewers, etc.

Assist in developing a searchable project repository that holds past, current, and future projects. Gather and transfer past projects to repository, create project summary, add tags, and attach deliverable (report, dashboard link, etc.).
Assist in socializing insights to the organization. Create a communication plan and design team page.
What you'll need:
You are a junior, senior, or graduate student majoring in experience design, statistics, economics, marketing, or social sciences with strong research/data analysis
General knowledge of basic office applications (Microsoft suite), especially Excel
You have excellent communication skills, collaborative working style, and ability to work well in a fast-paced environment
You are flexible and willing to help where needed
Organizational skills with attention to detail
Ability to keep confidential information
Bonus points for:
Experience with Qualtrics
Experience with surveys (design and fielding)
Experience with statistical analyses tools (Python, R, SPSS, etc.)
Benefits & Perks:
You will be part of an engaged, inclusive, global community that values family, giving back, beauty, and sustainability. We offer competitive benefits with comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage; supplemental life, short-term, and disability insurance; free access to health coaches, therapists, and an onsite fitness center; a health savings account & 401k with company match; an incentive bonus program; and access to our top-quality beauty & wellness products. You'll also be empowered to prioritize what's important to you through flexible work arrangements and a generous vacation policy. Thinking about expanding your family? We have generous maternity and paternity leave too.
Our Commitment:
We are committed to seeking, developing, and empowering diverse individuals and perspectives. We seek to be a global community where every employee and consumer knows and feels they belong. Description
Our Buildings practice keeps people at its heart, recognizing that our shared journey forward is shaped by the meaningful and responsive places we design. Your Opportunity
Stantec’s Sustainability Building Performance team is a collaborative and creative group of multi-disciplinary professionals. We provide professional consulting services that support innovative, high-performance projects in the built environment.
Our service areas include building performance engineering, building science, energy auditing, comminssioning and energy management, sustainable design, infractructure, community development, and resilient design strategies. We are seeking a highly motivated consulting professional with specialized expertise in integrated design, high performing building, and health and wellbeing. The successful candidate will contribute technically to our team’s existing portfolio of high performing buildings and LEED, WELL and Fitwel projects, and will also contribute to community scale consulting assignments.
The successful candidate is a sustainability professional with a related graduate degree and five years of professional experience in a related area. You have a strong background in sustainability issues with an understanding of sustainability best practices, policy, and rating tools.

Your Key Responsibilities
Manage and deliver projects and programs.

Communicate sustainability requirements and obligations to other team members

Prepare and coordinate documentation required for certification.
Conducting research and technical analysis, as required, for projects and reporting on findings.
Preparing quality client deliverables in a timely and profitable manner.
Execute projects to meet client expectations.
Interpret trends and statistics.
Prepare and deliver presentations to clients and/or design teams.
Qualifications

Excellent planning and organization skills required for our fast-paced environment.
Outstanding verbal communication skills with the ability to deliver persuasive and compelling presentations.
Strong technical report writing and proposal development skills.
Ability to think broadly across several focus areas and bring together an optimized solution.
Analytical thinking to draw sensible conclusions from own work and communicate these clearly to others.
Detailed knowledge of the LEED rating systems and / or other sustainability rating system programs including, Passive house, living building challenge, WELL and Fitwel
Working knowledge of sustainable design and alternative energy strategies for buildings and communities
An undergraduate degree or diploma in sustainability, green development, environmental sciences, planning, interior design, engineering, applied sciences, architecture, or its equivalent.
Knowledge of building codes, standards, and protocols referenced in LEED and other sustainability standards (such as ASHRAE).

Education and Experience
Minimum three to seven years of green building certification work experience.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in architecture, buildings engineering, science, or energy related field(s) (Graduate degree is an asset).
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

Foods people love. Brands people trust. And a career that nourishes your future like no other!

Foods people love. Brands people trust. And a career that nourishes your future like no other! You know us as the food and beverage company behind a lot of your favorites like Stouffer’s, Nesquik, Toll House, MILO, and Lean Cuisine, as well as new discoveries like Sweet Earth and Chameleon Cold-Brew coffee or Abuelita Hot Chocolate. Across our organization, we’re creating a workplace where collaboration is key, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm to delight our consumers every single day!
Global Brands is a diverse, rapidly growing division within Nestle USA committed to bringing people together and ‘sharing a taste of home’. We both bring international brands to market and grow brands from the ground up with a focus on bringing flavors from countries and cultures all over the world to the most diverse, multicultural country in the world.

As Associate Brand Manager – Base Business in our Global Brands Division you will be responsible for the creation of 3-year strategy plans and annual brand plans that generate demand for two of our unique and beloved global brands with significant growth aspirations. You will be the brand/business leader that will partner with diverse multifunctional teams to define category and brand/commercial metric growth plans, innovation and renovation strategies and manage product portfolio based upon consumer, category and competitive data and insights and drive projects from concept to post-launch business analysis and tracking. You will explore new business models (eg DTC) and territories (eg plant based) for the brand, understanding right to win and creating new routes to market, while driving sustainability agenda. This is a unique opportunity to play a role in defining the future of food / beverage and pursue a career in brand building and innovation at Nestle.
What You Will Do:
Define a 3-year consumer centric strategy and build annual brand/product/commercial plans and portfolio strategies to drive long-term category, brand and sales growth including brand equity, awareness and engagement metrics.
Execute Long term, annual Brand/Commercial Plan and everyday business activities such as Forecasting and communicating progress, issues or opportunities to cross functional team to deliver on key business and brand metrics .
Develop and leverage market intelligence agenda to support a deeper understanding of category, consumer, shopper by understanding drivers of the brand to:
1) Address knowledge gaps in consumer, brand, product, business and marketplace learnings.
2) Generate demand and activate product development, promotional initiatives.
3) Translate business strategy into action with executional excellence that delivers measurable impact
Continuously strengthen brand positioning by understanding and leveraging what the brand stands for in the hearts and minds of consumers (in US and globally) including brand identity, essence, vision, mission and core values to drive relevant innovation/renovation.
Lead multifunctional Monthly Business Planning Process by mastering 4Ps & 3Cs to:
Analyze consumption data, panel data, internal sales data and primary research to diagnose category and busines performance, identifying issues and opportunities for growth.
Connect day-to-day to bigger picture in relentless pursuit of value creation by digging deeper into root causes, thinking about cross-functional impacts, and challenging the status quo in your brands and products.
Manage simultaneous end-to-end marketing projects with detailed project timelines tracking and prioritizing brand initiatives to ensure delivery of project milestones on time & on budget, while owning communication to broader organization.
Partner and lead a high performing cross functional team including Finance, Market Research, Sales, Product Development, Regulatory, Manufacturing, Packaging Design and Project management to drive brand value and growth.
Showcase your creativity and curiosity for our consumers by assessing creative territory that brings our brands to life and enables effective consumer communication with a digital and social first approach including recommended activation/implementation plan, stewardship and brand health measurement.
Exercise quick decision-making abilities and business savviness around investment alternatives that mitigate risk and maximize return, sparking interest and selling aspects of brand plans to stakeholders, senior executives and customers.
Own your development as a Marketer by mastering fundamental elements across innovation, communications, and base assignments (potentially across different brands and divisions).

What You Can Bring:
A passion for food and beverage and the desire to understand how we can meet the ever-changing needs of our beloved consumer base and customers with our brands and products.
Entrepreneurial drive and intellectual curiosity, enjoying a fast- paced environment focused on continual improvement and comfortable on making recommendations with imperfect data and comfortable with ambiguity.
Strong analytical problem-solving and storytelling, comfortable pulling, managing, driving insights from quantitative, qualitative and digital platforms that distill insights into a clear strategy/POV & relevant go-forward plan to leadership.
Demonstrated thought leadership in making recommendations to all levels of a highly matrixed organization
Highly collaborative: Experience managing cross functional teams within several environments and aligning internal/external stakeholders to deliver business results.

Requirements and Minimum Education:
Minimum of 3 years of work experience in consumer marketing, brand management or product management
Completed bachelor’s degree in marketing or business administration.
Must have achieved proven results developing strategic brand / product plans, such as commercialization strategies that break from the category and drive sales across various channels, digital communications, and consumer promotions, etc.
Project Management experience, with a proven ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams and external agency partners, with a strong sense of urgency/bias for action.
Moderate understanding of total commercial spend and key P&L drivers; experience managing large consumer marketing budget and media investment decisions
Process oriented but Adaptability + flexibility to meet changing marketplace dynamics and priorities

Preferred Experience:
MBA is strongly preferred.
Base and previous innovation experience strongly preferred
Experience in leading CPG is preferred
Food and Beverage, RTD experience is a plus.
Global cross functional teams experience is preferred.

What You Will Get
Joining an industry leading organization doesn’t have to be just another job! At Nestlé it’s about nourishing YOU. Our team offers a comprehensive benefit plan inclusive of tuition reimbursement, health and wellness support, a generous parental leave policy, training and development to magnify your career, and discounts and access to the best brands on the shelf.

Environmental Markets Analyst
The Earth Partners is looking for a highly motivated, full-time Environmental Markets Analyst to support our business development and sales functions. You will be an instrumental member of our team, supporting revenue generation and the growth of the business, by developing financial models, collecting & analyzing data, and communicating results to management & capital partners to further the company’s land restoration-focused mission. We’re a virtual team, so this position is remote and you can be located anywhere in the U.S.
Primary Responsibilities:
Analyze data from internet & interview-based research and publicly available datasets
Create financial models that incorporate multiple scenarios, sensitivity analyses, and transaction structures
Track funding opportunities for land restoration projects, including requests for proposals, environmental impact statements, capital improvement plans, etc.
Synthesize and distill results in various formats, including spreadsheets, memoranda, and oral presentations
Provide support for tasks associated with the management and sales of mitigation assets
Skills Needed to Meet the Above Responsibilities:
Highly proficient in Microsoft Suite, particularly Excel
3+ years’ experience conducting data driven research and financial modeling
Ability to succinctly communicate the results of analytical work in a way that a variety of audiences can understand
Strong attention to detail in both research and in reporting results
Ability to effectively prioritize work across multiple projects
Ability to exercise independent judgment in carrying out assignments within established guidelines
Passion for natural resources conservation
To apply, please submit a resume to jobs@teplp.com with answers to the questions below. Note that you do not need to submit an accompanying cover letter.
Application Questions
Why are you interested in working for The Earth Partners and why are you interested in this position?
What inspires you? How do you cultivate your passions?
What unique skills/strengths would you bring to this role that would set you apart from other candidates?
What responsibility or skill listed in the job description will be the most challenging or biggest stretch for you? What skills/experience will you leverage to bridge that gap?
Do you have examples of analytical models and/or financial pro formas that you have developed?
Which of our Core Values (below) resonates with you most? Why?
Be inspired by nature and maintain passion for the protection and restoration of natural systems
Embody entrepreneurialism through creativity, risk tolerance, self-motivation, and constant curiosity
Be generous to others by listening deeply, exhibiting empathy, communicating openly, and understanding differences
Value growth in both our business and in ourselves and strive to continuously raise the bar
Foster a culture that appreciates a multitude of skill sets and backgrounds that are aligned to achieve the larger purpose of our work

Salary

$20.23 - $35.21 Hourly
$42,088 - $73,233 Annually
This position is a Pay Band 75

Purpose of Position
THIS POSTING WILL BE USED FOR ON-GOING RECRUITMENT AND WILL REMAIN OPEN UNTIL FILLED.
Why does the job exist?
The purpose of the position is to perform a technical and regulatory review of the most technically complex construction air quality permit applications. This review includes verifying emissions calculations, determining applicable state and federal regulations, and drafting legally enforceable air permits and technical support documents using standardized templates and protocols to compile a quality administrative record. This position supports the Permit Programs Section of the Air Quality Bureau through a variety of special projects that enhance the efficiency of the Section. These include project management of software projects, database maintenance & quality assurance, and other special projects as needed.
How does it get done?
This permit specialist performs detailed technical and regulatory reviews of complex construction air quality permit applications within regulatory deadlines and completes a variety of special projects.
Who are the customers?
This position requires coordination with various stakeholders; including the public, industry, consultants, bureau staff, and other regulatory agencies.
Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate must have strong technical and mathematical skills, be capable of handling multiple projects at a time, meet regulatory deadlines, and be attentive to detail.
Minimum Qualification
Bachelor's degree in Physical, Natural, or Environmental Science, Soil Science, or Engineering and five (5) years of experience in public/environmental health, environmental science, Air Quality Management, Biology, Engineering, Chemistry, Geology, Hazardous Waste Management, Wildlife Management, and/or Water Resources. Substitutions Apply. See Substitution Table below.
Substitution Table

These combinations of education and experience qualify you for the position:

 Education Experience Education Experience

1 High School Diploma or Equivalent AND 9 years of experience OR High School Diploma or Equivalent AND 9 years of experience
2 Associate's degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 7 years of experience Associate's degree or higher in any field AND 9 years of experience
3 Bachelor's degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 5 years of experience

4 Master's degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 3 years of experience

5 PhD degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 1 year of experience

Education and years of experience must be related to the purpose of the position.
If Minimum Qualification requires a specific number of "semester hours" in a field (e.g. 6 semester hours in Accounting), applicants MUST have those semester hours in order to meet the minimum qualifications. No substitutions apply for semester hours.

Employment Requirements
Must possess and maintain a valid driver's license.
Working Conditions
Work is performed in an office setting with infrequent travel to visit industrial sources of air pollution and attend training, must be able to climb stairs and ladders. Normal work schedule is Monday through Friday.

Climate & Sustainability Summer Intern Cascadia Consulting Group, Inc. Position in Seattle (WA), Oakland (CA), or Charleston (SC)  www.cascadiconsulting.comCascadia Consulting Group is a women-owned, private environmental consulting firm with 28 years of experience developing and implementing innovative solutions to today’s environmental challenges.Cascadia works with public and private sector clients to advance sustainability through recycling and materials management, climate change mitigation and adaptation, energy efficiency, pollution prevention, transportation demand management, and water and natural resources management. TheCascadia team brings both established expertise and creative thinking to research and analysis, strategic planning, program design and implementation, outreach, social marketing and behavior change, and evaluation roles. From our offices in Oakland (CA), Seattle (WA), and Charleston (SC), we serve clients across the country.At Cascadia, we strive to create an equitable and inclusive environment at all levels of the organization.Having staff and partnerships that reflect the diverse communities we serve empowers us to shape innovative and effective solutions together with those most impacted by social, human, and environmental health challenges.Position Overview We are offering a summer internship to one individual to support our climate, sustainability, and natural resources analysis and planning work. Key aspects of the work will include researching policies and best practices, analyzing greenhouse gas emissions and climate change impacts, facilitating workshops and meetings, conducting interviews, preparing literature reviews, and distilling and translating complex information into clear, compelling materials for diverse audiences. The distribution of work among these key aspects will vary based on project load and applicant skillset. We are seeking applicants with excellent written and oral communication skills and strong quantitative and creative problem-solving capabilities as well as an interest in public and stakeholder engagement. Examples of work include the following:Support analytical tasks, such as greenhouse gas inventories, climate vulnerability assessments, and sustainability metrics tracking and analysis efforts.Conduct desktop research and interviews, analyze information and data, and synthesize findings into clearly written informative summaries, fact sheets, presentations, and reports.Research and track trends, issues, and policies related to climate change mitigation and adaptation, renewable energy, water resource management, habitat conservation, and other sustainability and conservation topics.Generate external-facing materials on climate change and sustainability topics for stakeholder meetings, public events, and websites and online dashboards.Support facilitation of multi-stakeholder meetings, workshops, task forces, and committees dedicated to a range of environmental topics.Perform other duties as required.Required Qualifications This position requires a candidate with the following qualifications:Understanding of, and commitment to, Cascadia’s mission to “inspire and empower communities everywhere to protect and restore our world in an equitable and inclusive way.”A commitment to racial equity and the ability to apply racial equity principles to project work with clients, partners, and colleagues in an innovative and culturally responsible way while exhibiting emotional intelligence (i.e., culturally responsive engagement and facilitation).A minimum of 3-4 years of professional experience (or a current or recently graduated master’s student) working on climate, sustainability, and/or natural resource management issues.Demonstrates understanding of climate change issues including major greenhouse gas emissions sources, anticipated climate impacts, and climate policy solutions.Effective written and verbal communication skills in English with the ability to adapt to a diversity of styles and perspectives, and the ability to communicate scientific and technical ideas clearly using simple, commonly accepted language.Intermediate to advanced experience producing deliverables with Microsoft Office 365 programs including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Excellent organizational and documentation skills, along with great attention to detail.Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and deadlines.Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to handle challenging situations with tact and sensitivity.Ability to work independently, with minimal guidance, as well as an ability to work effectively as part of a team.Work Schedule Demand for this work can vary throughout the summer. It is anticipated that this role will offer at least 32 hours per week (80% FTE), with the potential for additional hours, and will last 10-12 weeks, starting as soon as possible. This work may require flexible hours, or it may have designated hours. It may also have short periods of intensive work. Internship positions are considered part of Cascadia’s roster of on- call employees, and as such Cascadia does not guarantee that you will receive a specific number of work hours. Our goal is to determine work schedules at least 1-2 weeks in advance of planned work, so you can plan your schedule accordingly. There is potential for this internship to transition into a regular, non- remote role at Cascadia, depending on work availability and performance.Compensation This is a temporary, hourly, non-exempt position. Cascadia will compensate this role with an hourly wage of $20+/hour, dependent on experience. Temporary staff are not immediately eligible for health benefits. The location of this internship could be based in Washington, California, or South Carolina; there is a potential for this position to be fully remote, as long as the employee resides in one of these states.How to Apply Submit a compelling cover letter, complete chronological resume, and short essay. The cover letter should address your ability to meet the criteria in the Required Qualifications section and highlight relevant experience, education, and why you are interested in this position. The essay should be in answer to this question: If you could do one thing to address climate change, what would it be and why? (There is no single right answer to this question. You are welcome to research online, but it is not required.) Please limit your response to 250 words and attach it to your application email as a PDF or Word Document. Send all three documents to jobs @cascadiaconsulting.com and indicate “Climate & Sustainability Intern - [Your Name]” in the subject line. Please state where you learned about the position. As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty.


The Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) is an independent research center at the University of Washington. Its mission is to deliver to the world timely, relevant, and scientifically valid evidence to improve health policy and practice. IHME carries out its mission through a range of projects within different research areas including the Global Burden of Diseases, Injuries, and Risk Factors; Future Health Scenarios; Cost Effectiveness and Efficiency; Resource Tracking; and Impact Evaluations. Our vision is to provide policymakers, donors, and researchers with the highest-quality quantitative evidence base so all people live long lives in full health.


IHME is committed to providing the evidence base necessary to help solve the world’s most important health problems. This requires creativity and innovation, which is cultivated by an inclusive, diverse, and equitable environment that respects and appreciates differences, embraces collaboration, and invites the voices of all IHME team members.


IHME has an outstanding opportunity for a Data Analyst on the Gender Equality Metrics team. The main purpose of this position is to provide highly specialized oversight and guidance of routine but complex extraction processes for input data used in modeling, papers, and presentations at IHME. The Data Analyst will provide support to key research projects through data extraction and formatting, and providing inputs for papers and presentations.


The main purpose of the Data Analyst position is to provide support to research projects through database management, data quality management, computational support to multidisciplinary research projects, data extraction and formatting, and providing key inputs for papers and presentations. Data Analysts are tasked with developing an understanding of different research needs and analytic functions across multiple projects to best meet researcher needs. We are looking for an individual who is able to independently translate requests into actionable results through interactions with research databases, formulation of displays of results, and development of complex code to be applied to a variety of quantitative data. The role calls for dexterity in working with complex databases and the ability to assess, transform, and quality control results, and utilize quantitative data using coding languages including Stata and R to ensure that other team members have exactly what they need to incorporate the data and results into their own components of the analytic process, presentations, and papers.


Additionally, this position will work alongside other Data Analysts on complementary projects and will require knowledge and skill sharing and collective problem-solving. Overall, the Data Analyst will be a critical member of an agile, dynamic research team. This position is contingent on project funding availability.


Responsibilities:


Research command

Become familiar with substantive areas of expertise to understand the dimensions and uses of gender and health data and the analytic underpinnings of different research streams.

Work directly with researchers to identify the source of data used in models and results, understand the context of the data, and ensure that they are relevant to the analyses themselves.

Create and document efficient, effective, and replicable methods for extracting data, developing code, organizing data sources, managing data quality, and explaining complex analytic processes.


Data management and analytics

Problem-solve computational and analytic challenges by investigating the data, understanding the root questions, and coming up with alternative measurement strategies.

Implement code solutions in order to answer analytic questions, perform diagnostics on results, and test and assess new methods.

Maintain, update, and adapt databases containing health data from multiple sources.

Maintain, update, and carry out routine but complex computational processes and statistical modeling that are central to generating estimates of key indicators.

Execute queries on databases and resolve intricate questions in order to respond to the needs of senior researchers and external requests from collaborators, media, policymakers, donors, and other stakeholders.

Bring together data, analytic engines, and data visualizations in one seamless computational process.

Use protocols to identify problems with datasets and routine computational processes, rectify issues, and systematize data for future analyses.

Transform and format datasets for use in ongoing analyses. Catalog and incorporate these datasets into databases. Perform quality checks.

Publications, presentations, and data requests

Create text, tables, figures, and charts for presentations and publications.

Provide referencing and other support for publications and presentations.

Execute queries on databases to respond to the needs of senior researchers and external requests from collaborators, media, policymakers, donors, and other stakeholders.


General

Communicate clearly and effectively while contributing as a member of the Institute.

Create tables, figures, and charts for presentations and publications.

Provide referencing and other support for publications and presentations.

Communicate clearly and effectively while contributing as a member of the Institute.

Work closely with other team members to assist with relevant tasks, facilitate learning new skills, and help resolve emerging problems on different projects.

Participate in overall community of the Institute, carrying out duties as required as team members with other Institute members


As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For a complete description of our benefits for this position, please visit our website, click here.


REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree in social sciences, engineering, computer science, or related field plus two years’ related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. As a rule, a bachelor’s degree is equivalent to 4 years’ experience.


Additional Requirements:

Demonstrated success in developing code in R.

Demonstrated ability in using databases with large-scale, complex datasets.

Adept diplomacy and exemplary interpersonal skills required. Must be agile at forming respectful and rewarding relationships with people with different levels of experience and expertise from a variety of cultural, linguistic, and professional settings.

Strong organizational skills and the ability to successfully manage multiple tasks and priorities to meet established and changing deadlines.

Deep interest in global health, population health, and/or ways in which quantitative research and data science can be used to create valuable global public goods.

Demonstrated self-motivation, ability to absorb detailed information, flexibility, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, energetic, highly creative, and collaborative environment.

Ability to learn new information quickly and apply analytic skills to better understand complex information in a systematic way.

Strong quantitative aptitude.


A commitment to working to alongside others at IHME to illuminate the health impacts of systemic racism and to work within IHME to make our organization more diverse and inclusive. See IHME’s DEI statement here: http://www.healthdata.org/get-involved/careers/dei.


Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


DESIRED

Experience analyzing and/or manipulating spatial data.

Coding experience, including but not limited to use of Stata.

Demonstrated interest in the field of gender and/or inequalities research.

Weekend and evening work sometimes required.

This position is open to anyone authorized to work in the US. The UW is not able to sponsor visas for staff positions.

Office is located in Seattle, Washington. This position is eligible to work fully remote in the US; work schedule required to overlap 50% of IHME office hours, between 8 a.m. and 6 p.m. Pacific Time.


Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.

Microsoft’s Cloud Supply Chain & Provisioning (CSCP) business unit is responsible for key aspects of the cloud supply chain, from planning and execution to capacity provisioning, decommissioning and dispositioning of datacenter assets worldwide. CSCP also has responsibility for managing and executing the cloud sustainability strategy, ensuring that the cloud supply chain is continually optimized to support Microsoft’s environmental goals for a sustainable future.
As Microsoft scales to become the global leader in cloud deployments and services, the scope of our efforts requires rethinking and transformation via innovative business processes and a high degree of standardization across the entire asset value chain, to ensure our leadership in sustainability and focus towards a circular economy.
The role will be key to this transformation, helping to articulate and harmonize our sustainability strategy across the wider organization. This role will integrate sustainable practices into partnerships across our value chain, driving us towards a circular economy model. The role will interface with resources across the broader organization to ensure that we leverage and contribute towards supportive and complementary efforts, and drive towards standardized sustainable approaches to the entire asset lifecycle, from design through end-of-life. The role will also be required to foster links to internal and external partners that promote innovation and policies on sustainability, to assert our leadership position in cloud sustainability.
Responsibilities
Product Manager for sustainability products being managed within our organization, working with customers to collect requirements and engineers to complete build of products
Partner with all applicable cloud sustainability pillars; data science, product development, operations, and engineering to ensure best-in-class, accurate and timely solution delivery and communications
Establish a communication framework to educate and build awareness of sustainability internally and across the partner network, of Microsoft’s continued impact and leadership towards a circular economy
Identify critical risks to deployment of a standardized sustainability framework, recommend, develop and implement solutions to mitigate those risks
Be proactive in identifying continuous improvement opportunities and act as a leader to drive resulting initiatives
Assist with corporate led carbon accounting activities and methodology alignment where applicable to products within the team
Demonstrable experience in collaborating across global operations, internal and external partners and vendors, engineering teams and senior leadership.
Qualifications
Qualifications
10+ years combined experience in Program Management, Asset Management, Supply chain processes, Sustainability, Circular economy, Marketing & Sales Communications, and Innovative business processes
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelors or equivalent degree qualification in Science, Engineering or Humanities
Demonstrable program management skills, including ability to direct multiple programs
Strong technical and analytical experience in the context of supply chains and sustainability
Strong understanding of global manufacturers, distribution partners, and marketplace vendors for cloud IT assets
Knowledge of disposition processes for server and network assets
Strong understanding of circular economy models, and an established network of sustainability practitioners and institutions
Ability to work independently when required, and as part of a team
Proven ability to work directly with partners and vendors with little supervision
Proven ability to write white papers and detailed process documentation
Strong organization and communication skills
Ability to think strategically beyond day-to-day execution
#cscpjobs

Overview:

Guidehouse is a leading management consulting firm serving the public and commercial markets. We guide our clients forward towards new futures that build trust in society and your professional skills along the journey. Join us at Guidehouse.
Responsibilities:

Consultants support project teams both at client sites and internally. Responsibilities will include client management, solution implementation and generation of project results. As a consultant, a key function of your role will be to create and present quality deliverables that support essential project workstreams. You will gather and analyze data, identify gaps and trends, and make recommendations related to baseline performance and structure, as well as established best practices and benchmarks.
We encourage career development and hiring for the long term. As a consultant, you will follow a clearly defined career path and continue to deepen your specialized industry knowledge and consulting skills. As you develop project management skills and leadership abilities, you will have the opportunity to progress to the Senior Consultant level.
Performing technical and economic analyses; data collection; spreadsheet creation and management
Assessing energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies
Building, mobility, greenhouse gas, technology impact modelling
Providing detailed fact finding, research, and analysis on business, sustainability, and energy-related activities

Developing business and sustainability strategies for large corporate, utilities, government, and energy companies
Communicating solutions and new strategies to clients through reports and presentations

Graduating with an undergraduate’s degree between December 2020 and June 2021 in a business, policy, environmental, economics, finance, engineering, science and/or related discipline
Strong interest in business strategy, energy, and sustainability
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with economic and financial analysis and research
Proactive and independent work style
Ability to assume ownership of significant portions of tasks while collaborating with a close-knit team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to travel as needed
Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills
Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently
Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment to coordinate work
Frequently travels by airplane, train or car as necessary to perform work at another location
Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data
Generally works in an office environment

The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

Company Description
McDonald’s is proud to be one of the most recognized brands in the world, with restaurants in over 100 countries that serve 70 million customers daily. As the global leader in the food service industry, our legacy of innovation and hard work continues to drive us.
From drive thru updates to delivery to mobile order and pay, we are innovating quickly and growing. Joining McDonald's means thinking big and preparing for a career that can have influence around the world.
At McDonald’s, we see every day as a chance to create positive impact. We lead through our values centered on inclusivity, service, integrity, community and family. From support of Ronald McDonald House Charities to our Youth Opportunity project and sustainability initiatives, our values keep us dedicated to using our scale for good: good for our customers, people, industry and planet. We also offer a broad range of outstanding benefits including a sabbatical program, tuition assistance and flexible work arrangements - check them out here!
While most of us are working remote during COVID-19, we're excited to get back to our state-of-the-art headquarters in the booming West Loop of downtown Chicago! It's set up to be a global hub that cultivates collaboration:
Take a class at Hamburger University
Sample future items in our Test Kitchen
Utilize the latest technology to connect with your team around the globe
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to the diversity of our crew members, staff, operators, and suppliers. We promote an inclusive work environment that creates feel-good moments for everyone. We are interested in people who enhance our company culture: Does this role interest you? We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every single requirement!
Job Description
The Opportunity:
Hamburger University is McDonald’s global center of excellence for learning and leadership development. Our Hamburger University Team inspires and enables people to learn new skills and behaviors, adopt new approaches and grow to be leaders who run great restaurants. Restaurant Leaders, Mid-Managers, and Directors from across the US attend courses at HU not only have a great learning experience while in Chicago at our Global Headquarters or virtually; they also benefit from increased capability and confidence that they can apply to improve their team and restaurant’s performance.
The Hamburger University (HU) Facilitator is part of the US Learning & Development Center of Excellence during a period of unprecedented innovation and advancement. The HU Facilitator is a key contributor to delivering world class learning experiences. This role will bring to life our values and is a role model of our cultural pillars each day through everything they do. This role will report to a National Learning Manager within HU.
The Facilitator is responsible for facilitating learning experiences in classroom and virtual formats, building individuals' leadership and job-specific competencies, and improving individuals' performance and contribution to business results.
The Facilitator is required to stay current on business initiatives and resources to connect learning to current and trending business strategies and focuses. This individual may participate in needs analysis (discovery) of learning needs, recommending and evaluating learning solutions. In addition, this position supports the execution of US L&D's priorities as well as our departments’ priorities and projects as needed.
This person is a self-starter and can execute under minimal supervision. They must be a strong communicator and facilitator; able to seek new ways of doing things, open to new ways of thinking, and demonstrate agility in unfamiliar situations. This person must take initiative to drive improvements for assigned accountabilities and will have an integral role in reinventing training for the U.S. Market.

This role is location at our Headquarters (MHQ) location in Chicago, IL. No relocation assistance is available at this time.
This role may include travel up to 25%
Qualifications
Key Accountabilities:
Facilitates learning experiences for all levels in classroom and virtual formats
Serves as an HU ambassador for licensees, suppliers, and employees
Represents and maintains awareness of the brand and departments across the organization
Communicates clearly and expressively and is easily understood, makes concise points, and displays appropriate level of energy
Collaborates effectively with co-facilitators, superiors and vendors; both in person and leveraging technology when virtual
Demonstrates proficiency with virtual facilitation; using unique features of classroom technology to sustain learner engagement
Assists with needs analysis, design, and development of learning solutions; supports with recommendation of learning or performance solution
Supports evaluation and measurement of programs and implements improvements as needed
Coordinates logistics according to budget and other project criteria
Supports team toward achieving department goals and priorities
Consults and liaises with field training and field operations
Experience and Capabilities:
2+ years of experience in virtual and in-person facilitation roles in corporate L&D, education, or professional settings
Working knowledge of adult learning theory and principles
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong listening ability to comprehend and draw connections for learning
Strong time management skills; ability to multi-task and perform effectively under time constraints
Team player, highly motivated self-starter even under stressful conditions
Ability to work with multiple internal and external customers and subject matter experts
Advocate for personal development that maintains field relevance and future interests and applications
Problem solving and decision making skills
Authentic and with a high degree of integrity
Demonstrates self-awareness and flexibility; open and responsive to feedback
Culturally competent and sensitive to diversity
Familiarity with Learning Management Systems (LMS) or related applications preferred
